loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages and detergents.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 56 años, está casada con Amador, con quien tiene seis hijos, de los cuales sólo viven con tres. Está familia habita en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.

Ella es de apariencia débil, pero de carácter fuerte y trabajador. Hace más de 30 años se dedica a la agricultura y con los conocimientos adquiridos en todos estos años puede asegurar que domina el trabajo en el campo. Tiene 12 de terrenos en producción donde siembra café, achiote, plátanos y un poco de yucas y naranjas. En esa extensión puede priorizar qué productos le convienen más y ampliar sus cultivos. “Este año estoy cosechando una cuadra de café y me va bien, a pesar de que el precio no es favorable”, menciona. Pero confía en que los próximos años sus otras parcelas producirán aún más y mejorarán sus ganancias.
Con la ayuda de su esposo, y los jornaleros que contrata, puede optimizar su trabajo y cubrir sus pedidos y no descuidar sus ventas.
Espera para más adelante cosechar el resto del café en cultivo, así podrá tener más ingresos y otorgarle a su familia mejores condiciones de vida.

Éste es su quinto préstamo con MFP, por eso da su palabra de ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Pertenece al banco comunal “Los Pomporitos de Shankivironi” y se siente contenta de tener compañeros responsables y activos.
Con el dinero que solita ahora podrá pagar a los jornaleros que limpiarán y cultivarán toda la extensión de café que posee.
texts.en:
Elsa is 56 years old and married to Amador, with whom she has six children. Three of them live at home. They have their own home located in the native community of Chanchamayo.

Elsa appears week but her character is strong and she is a hard worker. For more than 30 years she has worked in agriculture and with all the knowledge she has acquired in those years, it is sure that she will excel in the countryside. She has 12 production areas where she grows coffee, achiote, bananas and a little bit of yuca and oranges. With this many fields, she can prioritize which products are better for her and increase their harvest. "This year I am growing a block of coffee and it's going well even though the price is not favorable", she says. She trusts that in the next few years, her other parcels will produce more and increase her earnings. 

With the help of her husband and the day laborers that she hires, she can optimize her work and take care of both the pre-orders and her sales. She hopes to harvest the rest of the coffee that she is cultivating so that she can have more income and give her family a better standard of living. 

This is her fifth loan with MFP and she gives her word to be on time with her monthly payments. She belongs to the communal bank "Los Pomporitos de Shankivironi” and she feels happy to have responsible and active group members. With this current loan, she will be able to pay the day laborers that will clean and harvest all of the coffee that she has.

loans.use: pay her day laborers.

loans.name: Maisara

texts.ru: Майсара швея, она замужем и любящая мать троих детей. Муж на заработках в Российской Федерации. Более 10 лет Майсара занимается пошивом женских национальных платьев, а также подушек, одеял и других женских изделий. Майсара хотела бы получить займ для покупки швейной машинки и тканей для пошива платьев с целью расширения бизнеса. Она надеется на вашу доброту и милосердие.
texts.en: Maisara is a seamstress.  She is married and the loving mother of three children. Her husband is making a living in the Russian Federation. For more than 10 years Maisara has been sewing women's national dresses, as well as pillows, blankets and other women's articles. Maisara would like to receive a loan to buy a sewing machine and fabrics to make dresses, so that she can expand her business.  She looks forward to your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Aurea

texts.en:
Aurea is 57 years old and widowed with 2 children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Aurea is borrowing 12,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for a year and earns additional income from food vending.

Aurea is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional pig feed.

loans.name: Aileen Grace

texts.en:
Aileen Grace is married with three children. She is 34 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin.

Aileen Grace is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for ten years. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic and commercial fertilizers. 

Aileen Grace has been a member of PMPC for four years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic and commercial fertilizers.

loans.name: Rochelyn

texts.en:
Rochelyn is 22 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Rochelyn has a business catching and selling fish. She earns around 10,000 PHP each month doing this type of work. Rochelyn has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fishing supplies like hooks, gasoline and nylon fishing lines.

Rochelyn has been a member of PMPC for one year. In the future, she would like to own an additional fishing boat.

loans.use: to purchase fishing supplies like hooks, gasoline and nylon fishing lines.

loans.name: Malika

texts.ru: Малика- молодая женщина,мать троих детей- старшая дочь замиужем и сына женила.Воспитывает последнюю дочь вместе с мужем Нозимом.Имеет большой стаж в пошиве женской одежды, шьёт таджикским женщинам красивые платья.Раньше работала дома, теперь из-за потока клиентов арендует цех в центре города в многолюдном месте.Ей помогает дочь,которая уже научилась материнскому делу.Муж Малики тоже работает предпринимателем, торгует на базаре овощами.Вместе зарабатывая, семья содержат семью и проводят свои мероприятия благодаря своим доходам.Наш кредит Малика использует на покупку материи,из которых будет шить  национальные платья на продажу. У неё постоянные покупатели из дальних  районов.
texts.en:
Malika is a young woman and the mother of three children.  Her oldest daughter and son are married, so she and her husband, Nozim, only have their youngest daughter in their care.

Malika has been sewing women's clothes for a long time; she sews beautiful dresses for Tajik women. She used to work from home but now, because of an influx of customers, she rents a shop in a busy location in the center of town.  She is assisted by her daughter who has started to learn her mother's trade.

Malika's husband also works as an entrepreneur and sells vegetables at the market.  As all members of the family are working, they take care of each other and carry out their responsibilities thanks to their earnings.  

Malika will use our loan to buy fabrics so that she can sew national dresses and sell them.  She has regular customers who sometimes come from far away places.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to sew national dresses for women.

loans.name: Elsida Maria

texts.es: Elsida de 51 años, vive al sur de la ciudad, con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos en las edades de 16 y 28 años de edad; allí mismo, tiene una miscelánea donde vende artículos variados que requieren las familias de los alrededores de la vivienda donde habita y también se dedica al tradicional oficio de la confección de ropa en todas las líneas productivas. Su negocio lo inició cuando siendo adolescente y habiendo terminado sus estudios de bachillerato, ingresó al Servicio Nacional de Aprendizaje-SENA, Institución técnica educativa, apoyada por el Estado Nacional, y estudió costura de ropa realizando sus  practicas laborales, en diversos talleres familiares. Desde allí  empezó a promocionar sus productos en un mercado doméstico y con ello ganó muchos clientes, pero sobre todo mucha clientela, y con ello ingresos que le apoyaron el sustento familiar. Así continuó hasta estructurar bien su propio taller, como hasta hoy lo tiene y también aprovechó a sus compradores usuales, para adicionar actividades comerciales, es decir vender a crédito artículos que la gente le encargaba, organizando gradualmente su miscelánea de hoy,  donde vende de todo un poco. Con su negocio de confecciones, participa en eventos mercadológicos, como ferias, ruedas artesanales etc. Su expectativa de crecimiento no se detiene, por eso acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará una máquina plana industrial, con la cual avanzar en el mejoramiento de su técnica, de los tiempos productivos y hacer su labor cada día más efectiva, así mismo invertirá en telas en mayor volumen para conseguir mejores precios. Su meta es lograr actualizar sus equipos pues los que tiene son muy antiguos y muchas veces la limitan, Su mayor desafío es la competencia que ofrece mejores precios, a los que ella responde con calidad en el servicio para lograr sostenerse en el mercado.
texts.en:
Elsida is 51 years old and lives to the south of the city with her husband and two children, ages 16 and 28. There she has a general store where she sells various products that the neighborhood families need for their homes. She also engages in the traditional trade of making clothes of all types. Her business started when she was a teenager upon finishing her high school studies. She enrolled with the National Learning Service (SENA), a technical education institution that is supported by the national government. Elsida studied sewing and interned at various family-owned workshops. From that point, she began promoting her products at a local market and started to gain many customers. As a result of having all of these customers, she was able to earn income to support her family. She continued on to successfully build her own workshop, which she still operates to this day. Elsida also takes advantage of her usual customers by providing them additional services, such as extending credit to people who she trusts. She gradually organized her general store to the point that she is able to sell a little bit of everything. Her sewing business enables her to participate in trade events such as fairs, traveling craft exhibits, and other promotions.

The growth of Elsida's business is expected to continue, so she is requesting a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy an industrial upright sewing machine so that she can continue improving her technique, make productive use of her time, and become more effective in her work each day. At the same time, she will invest in fabrics in bulk so that she can obtain better prices. Her goal is to upgrade her equipment since it is very old and has restricted her on several occasions. Her greatest challenge is dealing with competitors who offer better prices, so she must respond by offering quality service in order to survive in the marketplace.

loans.use: to buy an industrial upright sewing machine and fabrics in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy beans, rice, flour, sugar, and other products.

loans.name: Elpedia

texts.en:
Elpedia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase spare parts for her motorcycle transport business.

Elpedia has been in this business for eight years. She earns additional income from farming vegetables.

Elpedia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts.

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion is married with 9 children. She is 54 years old and lives in Pan-ay, Clarin. Asuncion is a farmer. She raises livestock to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Asuncion has requested a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase additional livestock. She has been a member of PMPC for 3 years, and in the future, hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock

loans.name: Jardin Del Norte Group

texts.es:
El comité  Jardin del Norte se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de San Pedro. El grupo tiene 10 miembros, donde todas trabajan arduamente, para que, por medio de ese trabajo puedan ayudar a sus familias.
Marta es la presidenta del grupo, y ella nos comenta que siempre se esfuerza dentro del grupo para poder ayudar a sus amigas y que puedan salir adelante por medio de sus esfuerzos. Marta se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como ser cerdos y gallinas. Comenta que su trabajo es muy sacrificado, pero que le gusta mucho, ya que es muy digno y por sobre todo Honesto.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar alimento para sus animales, ya que no quiere tener escasez. Agradece por la ayuda que esta recibiendo, ya que fundación las ha apoyado mucho.
texts.en:
The committee "Jardin del Norte" (Garden of the North) was formed as a result of several neighbors from the city of San Pedro joining together. The group has 10 members, all of whom work hard so that they can help their families.

Marta is the president of the group. As a part of her group, Marta says that she strives to help her friends so that they can move forward in their efforts. Marta raises and sells animals, such as pigs and chickens. She says that her work requires great sacrifice, but she greatly enjoys earning a living in this manner because it is very dignified and, above all, honest. Marta is requesting a loan in order to buy feed for her animals because she does not want to be in short supply. She is grateful for the help that she has received since Fundación Paraguaya has already provided much support.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Altantsag

texts.en:
Mrs. Altantsag, 50, is a pensioner. Sometimes she produces dairy products and sells them to customers. She used to live in a rural area and moved to Ulaanbaatar, the capital city, in 2006. Since then, she has owned a small plot of land with her younger brother and his family in the ger district. A ger is a traditional Mongolian nomadic yurt. 

In 2010, she and her younger brother started building a small house, but it has still not been completed. She has requested a loan to make some remaining decorations. The loan will be used to buy the necessary building materials to complete her house.

loans.use: to buy the necessary building materials to complete her house.

loans.name: Efraín

texts.es:
Efraín tiene 20 años, vive con Nancy, con quien tiene un hijo de 3 años, llamado Jeyni. Juntos viven en su casa propia ubicada en una comunidad nativa de Chanchamayo.

Él posee tres parcelas de terrenos de cultivo donde desarrolla su principal actividad, la agricultura. Siembra kión, café, plátanos y un poco de yucas para el consumo de su familia. Todo esto lo aprendió en los 4 años que lleva como trabajador del campo. “De las cosechas de plátanos obtengo 15 cargas en camioneta, cada una de 1200 kilos. Me va bien”, menciona.
También se dedica al transporte de pasajeros en el motocarro de sus padres, pero sólo los sábados y domingos. Adicionalmente,  tiene otros ingresos de la pequeña tienda que instaló en su casa donde Nancy, su pareja, es quien se encarga de atender y administrar.
Efraín tiene muchos planes, uno de ellos es tener una solvencia económica adecuada para brindarle a su joven familia una vida mejor. Posteriormente piensa comprarse un terreno en la ciudad y construir una casa.

Éste sería su primer crédito con MFP, por eso se responsabiliza de pagar con puntualidad las cuotas. Además menciona estar cómodo en el banco comunal “Los Pomporitos de San Cristóbal”, donde acaba de ingresar, pues los socios son trabajadores y puntuales.
Con el dinero solicitado podrá comprar bolsas de abono orgánico, y pagar a los jornaleros que contratará para la limpieza de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Efraín, 20, lives with Nancy and they have a 3-year-old son named Jeyni.  They live in their own house in the native community of Chanchamayo.

He has three patches of cropland where here carries out his main activity, agriculture.  He grows ginger, coffee, bananas, and a few yuccas for family consumption.  He learned everything he knows during the four years he has worked in the fields.  "From the banana crop I harvest 15 truckloads of 1,200 kilos each.  It is going well for me", he says.  He also uses his parents' car to transport passengers on Saturdays and Sundays.  And he earns an additional income from a small store he set up in his house which his partner, Nancy, manages.

Efraín has many plans, among which is to have a good enough economy to give his young family a better lifestyle.  Then he wants to buy property in the city and build a house.

This is his first loan through MFP and he is committed to paying it back on time.  He says he is comfortable with his communal bank "Los Pomporitos de San Cristóbal", which he just joined, because all the members are hard workers and punctual.  He plans to use the loan to buy bags of fertilizer and hire workers to clear the land for his crop activity.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and hire workers.

loans.name: Mateo

texts.es:
Mateo tiene 43 años, vive con Antonia, con quien tiene cinco hijos. Todos ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en el distrito de Huasahuasi, Tarma.
Él domina las labores del campo, ya que desde niño se dedica a esta actividad. En las distintas parcelas de terrenos que posee siembra papas, habas y maíz. “Sí es cansado el trabajo, porque mis terrenos están lejos y para llegar se tiene que camina bastante”, menciona. Con la ayuda de su esposa, que siempre le lleva la comida a las horas exactas, y a sus hijos mayores que también acompañan a Mateo hasta sus parcelas, puede estar seguro que su esfuerzo dará buenos frutos. Uno de los problemas que siempre ha afrontado es el cambio climático de la zona, por el intenso frío y las lluvias. Pero a él no lo detienen y continúa en las labores. Una de sus metas más cercanas es ver a sus hijos mayores estudiar carreras técnicas o universitarias en la ciudad, por eso seguirá trabajando como hasta ahora. 

Con este crédito, serían 9 veces que Mateo trabaja con MFP y su Banco Comunal “Nueva Jerusalén”, de los que siente gran cariño por estar siempre pendientes de sus necesidades.
Con este préstamo podrá pagar a los jornaleros que trabajarán junto a él en la siembra de arvejas. Así también comprará tres bolsas de semillas de arvejas (a 55 soles cada bolsa).
texts.en:
Mateo, 43, lives with Antonia and they have five children.  They live in their own house in the district of Huasahuasi, Tarma.  His expertise is in agriculture, the activity he has been involved in since he was a child.  On his cropland he grows potatoes, lima beans and corn.  "Yes, the work is tiresome because my land is far away so I have to walk quite a bit", he says.  With the help of his wife, who always takes him lunch at the exact time, and his eldest children who always accompany Mateo to work, he can be sure his efforts will be fruitful.  One of the problems he is up against is the changing climate in the area, especially the intense cold and rains.  But no one can stop him from getting his job done.  One of his priority goals is for his eldest children to get a technical or university degree in the city.  So he plans to continue working as he has been until now.

This will be Mateo's ninth loan through MFP and his communal bank "Nueva Jerusalén", for whom he feels much affection as they are always looking out for him.

He plans to use the loan to hire workers to help him sow peas, and also buy three bags of pea seeds (55 PEN each).

loans.use: To buy seeds and hire workers.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es:
María Eugenia es madre soltera la cual lleva la responsabilidad de su hogar de proveer el sustento a sus hijos y darles lo mejor que pueda donde se gana la vida laborando como maestra de secundaria, salario que le permite cumplir con sus obligaciones.
Es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora que ha sabido criar sola a sus hijos.
Hoy en la actualidad está solicitando su cuarto crédito en Ceprodel para comprar pintura y pago de mano de obra con el fin de darle una mejor apariencia a su vivienda.
Espera y confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada para cumplir su objetivo y poco a poco cumplir su sueño de ver su casa realizada ya que con estos créditos es la única manera de realizarlos porque con su pequeño salario no podría llevarse a cabo estos sueños.
texts.en:
María Eugenia is a single mother who has taken responsibility for providing for her household, supporting her children, and giving them the best. In order to earn a living, María Eugenia works as a high school teacher. Her salary enables her to fulfill her obligations. She is a determined and enterprising woman who knows how to raise her children by herself.

Today she is requesting her fourth loan from CEPRODEL in order to buy paint and pay for labor so that she can give her home a better appearance. She hopes and trusts that God will approve of her request so that she can accomplish her goal and gradually fulfill her dream of having a finished house. The loans are the only means for this to happen because her salary is not enough to make her dreams a reality.

loans.use: to buy paint and pay for labor.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Editha works hard to support her family.

She has a business buying and selling dried fish in the Philippines, and earns additional income from the direct selling of Avon products. Editha is borrowing 29,500 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell for her business.

Editha has been sustaining her business activities through her past twelve loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 52 years old and married with 5 children.

Elizabeth works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 25,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Elizabeth has borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 4 years and also earns an income from electronic reloading, food vending and selling vegetables.

Elizabeth aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Norma

texts.es:
Norma tiene 45 años, está casada con César, con quien tiene cuatro 4 hijos, pero sólo viven con dos de ellos, ya que los otros dos están viviendo en otra ciudad. La casa donde habitan es propia y está ubicada en el distrito de Huasahuasi en Tarma.

Ella se dedica a la siembra de papa, maíz, arvejas y habas, cuyas ganancias le ayudan a cubrir sus necesidades básicas y algunos otros gastos. Lleva cerca de 20 años en esta actividad y menciona que le va bien, especialmente con la venta de papas y arvejas. También se dedica a la compra y venta de animales, tales como chanchos, vacas y cuyes. Ella adquiere pequeños cerdos, los que engorda en 4 meses y después los comercializa a buen precio. “Me gusta vivir en el campo, porque puedo sembrar tranquila y criar a mis animalitos con cuidado”, dice.
Adicionalmente, también compra y vende quesos, los compra a buen precio, por docenas, en su localidad y los lleva hasta otra ciudad (Huánuco) donde los reparte en mercados, y aprovecha para visitar a sus dos hijos. Realiza estos viajes cada dos veces al mes. Una de sus metas es adquirir un terreno en esa ciudad y llevar a su familia a vivir allí.

Éste es su préstamo número  9 con MFP, por esa razón menciona que será puntual en el pago de las cuotas. Pertenece al banco comunal “Nueva Jerusalén”, donde sus integrantes son buenos y responsables socios.
Norma invertirá el dinero que ahora solicita en la compra de semillas para sembrar arvejas, y otra parte del dinero lo invertirá en la compra de quesos.
texts.en:
Norma, 45, is married to César and they have four children, two of which live at home while the other two live in another city.  They live in their own house in the district of Huasahuasi in Tarma.

She grows potatoes, corn, peas and lima beans for a living, and uses the profits to cover basic needs and other expenses.  For nearly 20 years she has been in this trade and claims it is going very well, especially sales of potates and peas.  She also buys and sells animals such as pigs, cows and guinea pigs.  She buys piglets and fattens them for four months, then sells them at a good price.  "I like to live in the country, because I can grow my crops peacefully and care for my small animals", she says.

She also buys and sells cheeses.  For a good price she buys them by the dozen in her village and sells them in another city (Huánuco) where she delivers them to the markets and also takes advantage of the trip to visit her children.  She does this twice a month.  One of her goals is to buy property in the city so she can take her family to live there.

This is her ninth loan through MFP, so she is committed to paying it back on time.  She belongs to the communal bank "Nueva Jerusalén", where the members are good and responsible.  Norma plans to use the loan to buy pea seeds, and the rest to buy cheeses.

loans.use: To buy seeds and cheeses.

loans.name: Divino Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
El comité se Denomina “Divino Niño Jesus, está en el cuarto ciclo del programa de mujeres emprendedoras, y las miembros comentan que se unieron con ganas de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo también poder a sus familias.
Silvia es parte del grupo y nos comenta que gracias a la ayuda de sus compañeras y también a la fundación ha podido ir creciendo en sus negocios. Ella se dedica a la venta de joyas de plata, en lo que le esta yendo muy bien, ya que tiene buena clientela que siempre le hace pedido.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de joyas, como ser anillos, cadenas, pulseras y demás tipos, con los que podrá cumplir con los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
The communal bank is called "Divino Niño Jesus", and this is its fourth cycle in the women entrepreneurs' program.  The members claim they were excited about working together so they could help their families.

Silvia is a member who claims that thanks to her fellow team members' help and that of the foundation, she has been able to expand her business.  She sells silver jewelry and it is going very well, since she has a good number of customers who are always placing orders.

She is requesting a loan to buy jewelry such as rings, chains, bracelets and other items, so she can fill the orders she has.

loans.use: To buy rings, chains, bracelets and other items.

loans.name: Damas Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité "Damas Trabajadoras" esta en el 3º ciclo, ellas son amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de san ignacio. Ellas se unieron con las ganas de trabajar juntas y por medio de ese trabajo ayudarse las unas a las otras y tambien a sus familias.
La sra. Maria, es la Presidenta del grupo , ella orienta a sus compañeras a luchar por sus objetivos mediante la buena utilizacion del crédito, basada en la honestidad y la responsabilidad de cada una de ellas, asi mismo incentiva a  mantener la unidad en el grupo y fomentar el espiritu solidario.
 compromisos.
Maria solicita el crédito para la compra de prendas de vestir, sabanas, frazadas y demás productos que ella venderá y de esa forma tendra los ingresos que necesita para ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
The committee "Damas Trabajadoras" (Working Ladies) is in its third loan cycle. They are friends and neighbors from the city of San Ignacio. The members have united with the desire to work together so that they can help one another, as well as their families.

Sra. Maria is the group president. She advises her fellow group members to strive for their goals by making good use of their loans in an honest and responsible manner. They are provided with the incentive to maintain unity within the group and to foster a spirit of solidarity and commitment. Maria is requesting a loan in order to buy articles of clothing, bed sheets, blankets, and other products to sell so that she can generate the income she needs to help her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing, bed sheets, blankets, and other items.

loans.name: Zinnia Group

texts.en:
Demetria is married with two children. She is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Demetria is a farmer and grows rice to earn a living. She has been doing this for 25 years. She has requested a loan of 8,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

Demetria has been a member of PMPC for almost one year. In the future, she hopes to expand her agricultural land and have a rice mill of her own. Demetria is the leader of a three-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has his/her own business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To renovate her house (paint, stucco, windows, etc.)

loans.name: Daylin

texts.en:
Daylin is 42 years old and lives in Plaridel, Philippines. She is married with two children. 

To earn a living, Daylin has a meat shop business. She earns about PHP 3,500 each month doing this type of work. Daylin has requested a loan of PHP 10000 to purchase pigs and cows.

Daylin has been a member of PMPC for two years.  In the future, she would like to have enough savings for the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase pigs and cows for her meat shop

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 41 years old and has 2 children. She is married and has one child who is in school.

Liza is in the agricultural business, buying and selling livestock in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 30000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock to sell.

Liza has been buying and selling livestock for 13 years now, and has borrowed 7 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Liza would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase additional livestock to sell

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is 32 years old and lives in Dolores, Clarin. She is married with 2 children. 

Marife has a store that sells a variety of products. She has had this business for 3 years. She requested a loan of 10000 PHP to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, etc. 

Marife has been a member of PMPC for 7 years.  In the future, she hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, noodles, beverages, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is widowed with 9 children. She is 72 years old and lives in Lupagan, Clarin.

Loreta is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 20 years. She has requested a loan of 50000 PHP to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic and commercial. 

Loreta has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, she hopes to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase additional fertilizers such as inorganic and commercial

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 27000 through NWTF to buy more vegetables to sell for her vegetable vending business.

Lucy has been in this business for 5 years. She earns additional income from buying and selling dried fish, direct selling of Avon products and selling ice candy.

Lucy has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Monica Piedad

texts.es:
Mónica es una persona que se destaca por ser tranquila, alegre, muy trabajadora y tiene muchos deseos de superación. Mónica es soltera, vive con su hijo en la ciudad de Ibarra (La Esperanza) que se encuentra en la Provincia de Imbabura.

Mónica le pone mucho empeño a su trabaja debido a que tiene que sustentar sola los gastos de la casa y los estudios de su hijo, es por eso que necesita realizar una inversión para que su negocio crezca en cuenta a clientela como a ingresos económicos, que en un futuro ayudará a mejorar la calidad de vida de su hijo.

El crédito que solicita a Fodemi es para invertir en la compra de peinillas, cepillos, secadora, tintes para cabello, pinturas para uñas y algunos muebles que le hacen falta para brindar un buen servicio al cliente.

Mónica sueña en tener un salón de belleza grande, con ayudantes para brindar su servicio a mas personas y con esto sacar adelante a su hijo.
texts.en:
Mónica is a person who is known for being calm, cheerful, and a hard worker. She has tremendous drive to succeed. Mónica is single and lives with her son in the city of Ibarra (La Esperanza), which is located in Imbabura Province.

Mónica invests great effort into her work since she is the only one providing for the household expenses and the education of her son. For this reason, she needs to invest in her business so that she can grow her clientele and generate more income. In the future, this will help to improve her son's quality of life.

The loan she is requesting from FODEMI will be invested in the purchase of combs, brushes, hair dryers, hair dyes, nail polishes, and a few furniture pieces that she lacks in order to provide good service to her customers. Mónica dreams of having a larger salon and assistants who can provide service to more people. As a result, she will be able to help her son move forward.

loans.use: to buy combs, brushes, hair dryers, hair dyes, nail polishes, and a few furniture pieces.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 57 years old and married with seven children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lucia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell.

Lucia has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items, such as coffee, milk, soap and sardines, etc.

In the future, Lucia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell

loans.name: Mey

texts.en:
Mey is 30 years old. She is married and has been blessed with two school-age children. She and her husband raise the family in a small village in the Prey Chor district, Kompong Cham province. 

Mey plants rice crops for both sustenance and sale; whereas her husband is dedicated to the animal trading business. He buys and sells animals in the marketplace of the province. They aim to make a good income and to be able to educate their children. 

Mey said that she wants her two to become professional nurses, so that they can earn a good standard of living from this career and help a lot of people across the country.

Due to financial constraints, Mey is asking for a loan of KHR 2,500,000 to enable her husband to purchase cows for trading. This loan will play an important role in enabling her family to develop their business as well as improving their living conditions.

loans.use: to enable her husband to purchase cows for trading.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Ms. Arlene is married with three children. She is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines.

Ms. Arlene runs a piggery to earn a living. She has been doing this for two years. She has requested a loan of 7,000 PHP to purchase feed for her hogs/pigs. 

Ms. Arlene became a member of PMPC this year. In the future, she hopes to use the profits to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase feed for hogs/pigs

loans.name: Gonzalo

texts.es:
Gonzalo tiene 69 años de edad, es viudo, tiene 2 hijos mayores con los cuales vive en el municipio de la Lima, Cortes.
Don Gonzalo tiene un negocio de venta de utensilios de plástico. Se dedica a la venta de estos productos desde hace 15 años, este negocio es el que le ha generado los ingresos para salir adelante. Aunque tiene la ayuda de sus hijos mayores dice que siempre le ha gustado trabajar y generar su propio dinero. Los productos los vende de manera ambulante en una bicicleta en los alrededores del vecindario y ofrece platos, vasos, cubetas, tinas etc.  El ya cuenta con sus propios clientes por lo tanto sus ventas han mejorado favorablemente.
Agradece a ODEF por la ayuda y la confianza que le han dado al proporcionarle el capital de trabajo para su negocio. Ahora el solicita sus séptimo préstamo de 4,000 lempiras para compra productos como vasos, platos, cubetas y otros productos.
Su plan es surtir su negocio y ofrecer variedad de productos a los clientes y poder comprarse una bicicleta nueva porque con la que trabaja actualmente ya esta deteriorada.
texts.en:
Gonzalo is a 69-year-old widower who has two grown children who live with him in the town of Lima, Cortes.

Don Gonzalo has a business that involves selling plastic utensils. He has been selling plastic goods for 15 years. This business generates income so that he can move forward. Even though his grown children support him, Gonzalo says that he always enjoys working and earning his own income. He sells his products by traveling around the neighborhood on a bicycle. Gonzalo sells plates, cups, pails, basins, and other items. He already has his own customers and his sales have shown favorable improvement.

He is grateful to ODEF for helping and trusting him by providing operating capital for his business. Gonzalo is requesting his seventh loan in the amount of 4,000 HNL in order to buy products such as cups, plates, pails, and other items. His plan is to restock his business and offer a variety of products to his customers. He will also buy a new bicycle because the one he currently uses for his work has deteriorated.

loans.use: to buy plastic cups, plates, pails, and other items.

loans.name: Monina

texts.en:
Monina is 52 years old and married with four children. She is from Poblacion, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Monina used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell. Her business is successful and she's taking a new loan to obtain more rtw (ready-to-wear) products to sell. 

In the future she hopes to be able to grow her business.

loans.use: to obtain more rtw (ready-to-wear) products to sell

loans.name: María Isabel

texts.es:
María Isabel es una joven sauceña, madre de familia luchadora por el bienestar de sus hijos, que se gana la vida laborando como conserje, oficio que le ha permitido llevar por muchos años el pan de cada día a su hogar, mejorar su pequeña vivienda.
Tiene muchos años de trabajar con ceprodel y gracias a estos créditos ha mejorado su calidad de vida porque poco a poco ha adquirido bienes para su hogar objetivo que no hubiera podido llevar a cabo por su pequeño salario.
Hoy en día está necesitando un nuevo crédito para la compra de una refrigeradora ya que es de suma necesidad tener este tipo de electrodoméstico en un hogar para guardar los alimentos y así evitar que se desperdicien.
Espera que esta Institución le otorgue este crédito para poder cumplir su sueño de ver amueblada su vivienda.
texts.en: María Isabel is a young woman from  Sauce. She is a wife and mother who fights for her children's wellbeing. She makes her living working as a janitor, a trade which has allowed her to earn her family's daily bread every day, and improve her small house. She has worked with Ceprodel for years and thanks to the loans has improved her quality of life little by little because she has acquired things for her house, something she couldn't have done with her small salary. Now she needs a new loan to buy a refrigerator since it is very important to have this appliance in a home to keep food and avoid waste. She hopes this instituion will give her the loan so she can make her dream come true of having her home furnished.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator

loans.name: Mujeres En Desarrollo Group

texts.es:
Mujeres en desarrollo se llama en grupo integrado por 15 mujeres de la ciudad de Carapeguá.  Actualmente el comité se encuentra en el 10º ciclo donde todas las mujeres trabajan en un ambiente de cooperación y ayuda. Son señoras que se esfuerzan para salir adelante y solventar los gastos diarios del hogar.
La Sra Filomena es una de las integrantes que se esmera muchísimo para generar más ganancias, ella se dedica habitualmente a la artesanía, específicamente a la producción de hamacas, colchas y frazadas. Ella está muy contenta por formar parte del  programa Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, dice que  su actividad es muy provechosa ya que nota el progreso gracias al beneficio y oportunidad de la Fundación Paraguaya.
Ella solicita el crédito para comprar hilos, agujas, bastidores y demás insumos para poder seguir haciendo sus artesanías y de esa forma seguir ayudando a su familia.
texts.en:
Mujeres en Desarrollo [Women in Devlopment] is the name of a group made up of 15 women in the city of Carapeguá.  Right now the committee is in its 10th cycle and all of the women work in an environment of cooperation and help. They are women who work hard to get ahead and pay the daily expenses of their homes.  

Filomena is one of the members who strives to make more earnings. She works in artisanal crafts, specifically producing hammocks, blankets and bedspreads. She is very happy to be a part of the Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras program. She says that her activity is very advantageous since she has seen progress thanks to the benefits and opportunities of the Fundación Paraguaya.

She is asking for the loan to buy thread, needles, frams and more materilas to be able to keep making her artisanal crafts and thus keep helping her family.

loans.use: to buy thread, needles, frames and more.

loans.name: Thamar

texts.en: Thamar is 28 years old. She has a 10-month-old child. She has been selling memory cards, flash disks, and DVDs in her store. With the loan she has requested, she will buy more DVDs, CDs and flash disks to sell. She plans to use the profits for providing food for her family.

loans.use: To buy more flash disks, DVDs, and CDs to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
Mujeres unidad surge de la unión de 16 mujeres, amigas y vecinas de la ciudad de Villa Elisa. El grupo vio una gran ayuda en el programa de la fundación paraguaya y decidieron formar parte de el.
La Sra. Paulina es la presidenta del grupo, se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comidas en su casa. En lo cual recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y también de su marido, y así también puede ayudar en los gastos de la casa, que son muchos. Comenta que su meta es tener un copetín donde poder vender sus comidas y así tener mejores ingresos para ayudar a su familia.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra de carnes, condimentos, verduras, hortalizas y demás insumos para poder seguir preparando los alimentos que vende.
texts.en: Mujeres Unidas ("United Women") is a group made of 16 women, neighbours and friends from the city of Villa Elisa. The group saw the great help that the field partner's programme could be and decided to join Fundación Paraguaya. Paulina is the group's president; she prepares and sells meals at her home. Her husband and children help with this business, enabling her in turn to help with household expenses, which can represent quite a sum. Paulina says that her goal is to own a small restaurant where she could sell her meals and thus increase her income and help her family all the more. She asks for this loan in order to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, garden produce, and other ingredients to continue preparing the meals she sells.

loans.use: to buy meat, condiments, vegetables, garden produce, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Silvio José

texts.es:
El señor Silvio José es originario de una comarca aledaña al municipio de El sauce, es un señor luchador que tiene a su cargo su hogar conformado por una gran familia, el cual se desempeña como guarda de seguridad donde este oficio le permite llevar el sustento a esta humilde familia.
Dada las circunstancias que su familia  es bien numerosa tiene la necesidad en este momento de adquirir un solar con el fin de ampliar su vivienda con condiciones adecuadas para brindarles a sus pequeños hijos.
Tiene 9 meses de trabajar con ceprodel donde le han otorgado tres créditos para mejorar su calidad de vida, agradece a ceprodel este apoyo incondicional y confianza depositada porque estos créditos le permiten cumplir sus sueños de las personas de escasos recursos.
texts.en:
Silvio José comes from a region bordering the town of El Sauce.  He is a hard-working man who is responsible for his home, which is made up of a large family.  He works as a security guard, a job that allows him to support his humble family.  

At this time, given the fact that his family is quite large, he needs to acquire a building lot for the purpose of expanding his home and providing his little children with adequate living conditions.  

For the past nine months, he has been working with Ceprodel, where they have provided three loans to help him improve his quality of life.  He is thankful to Ceprodel for their unconditional support and trust because these loans allow poor people to fulfill their dreams.

loans.use: to purchase a building lot.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan, age 42, is from the Prey Chor district of Cambodia, where her hometown and business are located. She has a husband who is a local rice farmer. She has been blessed with four children, three of whom are single and one is married. 

Aside from helping her husband manage their rice farm, Chan has a business selling breakfast to the people in her commune. From this type of business, she is able to earn around $1.50 for extra income.

To satisfy her family's living needs and to support her children's education, Chan would like to obtain a loan from Kiva, through HKL, to purchase a used motorcycle. This will enable her children to commute to a school a far distance away. She is very appreciative of your help.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle for her children so they can commute to school.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 28 years old and lives in Usocan, Plaridel, in the Philippines. She is married and has one child. 

To earn a living, Joan has a grocery-store business. She earns about PHP 15,000 each month doing this type of work. Joan has requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase soft drinks, rice and assorted grocery items to sell in her store.

Joan has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Joan would like to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase soft drinks, rice and assorted grocery items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Sun

texts.en:
Sun is 55 years old and is in the business of cultivating rice alongside her husband in the Prey Chor district of Cambodia. She has been operating a farming business for nearly 12 years. Rice husbandry is the main source of the family’s income. She mainly uses her earnings to pay for daily food and allowance fees for her children. 

Presently, Sun is responsible for five children, three of whom are employed in the city of Phnom Penh. They usually contribute some of their income to support the family.

Sun wants to acquire her first loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a motorcycle for her children so they can commute to their workplaces. This vehicle will better their situation and cut down on transportation expenses each month. Sun is very grateful for your generosity toward her family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle for her children so they can commute to their workplaces.

loans.name: Dara's Group

texts.en:
Dara and her husband live in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district of Cambodia. They have been farming rice and planting cassava for nearly 20 years to support the entire family. 

Dara is 41 years old and has three children, all of whom are working at the rice field and cassava plantation. This is Dara’s first loan with VisionFund and she is now leading a group of two female members. 

Dara will use a portion of her loan to cultivate her rice field and plant more cassava. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her income so that her family can have enough food for daily living.

loans.use: To cultivate her rice field and plant more cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sum

texts.en:
Sum is 56 years old and married. She is responsible for six children. Five of her children are already married and live separately. So now she lives with her husband and a single child in a house in the Prey Chor district. She is a local cultivator who grows rice crops twice a year to generate income. She has been farming since she was with her parents.

With the loan amount of $1,000, Sum would like to pay to cultivate her rice crops this coming season. She hopes that she is able to have a good harvest with this investment. She plans to expand her business to achieve her goal.

loans.use: to pay to cultivate her rice crops.

loans.name: Sawe Mutiara Indah Group

texts.en:
With this new loan, the Sawe Mutiara Indah group will buy local piglets species and superior piglets. Local species are used for pigsroll and superior piglets for fattening.

Ayu Ketut is using the loan to purchase only the local species piglets in order to get faster cash flow. Funds available will also be used to support the efforts. She hopes the venture will develop and support each other for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to purchase only the local species piglets.

loans.name: Usaha Ternak Group

texts.en:
To continue and develop the business, the Usaha Ternak group continue borrowing. Because Ni Ketut has resigned from the membership, the group held a new election for a new secretary.

The loans were used to buy local piglets and superior piglets. Wayan already has sows, so her loan is used to buy food and fix the cage. Because the cage is now inadequate to accommodate the pigs, the piglets are roaming in her garden. She hopes that the cage will be fixed immediately so the pigs do not roam and disturb the neighbors. 

With this effort, Wayan supports her husband to fulfill the needs of their family.

loans.use: to buy a saw.

loans.name: Sawe Rahayu Indah Group

texts.en:
Although the group earned good profits in the last loan, they still need a new loan for their business because they have a strong will to become a successful pigs business. The loan will be used to improve their businesses by buying superior piglets or a sow.

Ni Komang, is using the loan to buy three superior piglets. She has a plan to maintain them until they become sows. She wants to become a piglet seller in her village. She hopes MUK and Kiva will always support her and the group, not only for the loan but for training also.

loans.use: to buy three superior piglets.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is married and has five children. He is 54 years old, residing at Upper Bayao, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines.

Eduardo plants and harvests rice for sale in the local community to earn a living and his been 25 years in this business. Each month, he earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of business.

He requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop. In 2011, Eduardo joined GDMPC. In the future, Eduardo wants to save as a reserve for future emergencies and to purchase more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings for the next crop.

loans.name: Noth's Group

texts.en:
Noth is a villager living in a rural area of Dambae district. She is 60 years old and a mother of two. One of her children is still staying with the family and working as a farmer. 

For almost 30 years, Noth and her husband have been planting cassava and farming rice to support the family. 

Noth obtained a loan from VisionFund in 2009. Noth successfully paid the first loan to VisionFund and this loan has enabled her to better feed her family.

Noth, with the other two members of the group, is now requesting another loan from VisionFund. As a leader, Noth plans to use this loan to buy fertilizers, rice seeds and more cassava for planting. She hopes this loan will help to increase her income and her family can live in better conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers, rice seeds and more cassava for planting

loans.name: Mujeres Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Trabajadoras es de la Ciudad de San Lorenzo, donde  las integrantes del comité fijaron como objetivo el crecimiento de cada una de ella dentro de un ambiente de ayuda entre ellas.
La Sra. Maria Isabel, presidenta del grupo tiene 30 años, esta casada y tiene 2 hijos. Ella se dedica a las ventas, tiene una despensa bien surtida mediante la cual ha podido darle a su familia lo que necesitan y de esa forma evitar que pasen por necesidades como las que ellas tuvo que pasar. Su meta es seguir creciendo e ir agrandando su negocio.
Ella solicita el crédito para surtir su negocio con enlatados, bebidas, lácteos y demás artículos de primera necesidad, y de esa forma poder seguir dando a sus clientes buena variedad.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Trabajadors [Working Women] committee is from the city of San Lorenzo. The committee members set a goal for each of its members to grow within a supportive environment. 

Maria Isabel, 30, is the president of the group and is married with two children. She makes her living in sales, she has a well-stocked pantry through which she has been able to give her family what they need and in this way avoid having to give up basic necessities as she once had to. Her goal is to continue growing and expand her business. 

She is requesting this loan to stock her store with canned goods, drinks, dairy, and other basic staple products and in this way she is able to continue giving her customers a good variety.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, drinks, dairy, and other basic staple products

loans.name: Phon

texts.en:
Phon, 21, lives in Ang Snoul district with his wife and lovely child. 

He is in the farming business and at the same time raises hogs to sell for extra income. He has built a small wooden piggery in which he can place only a few pigs. He still wants to improve his hog raising business and renovate his piggery again in order to provide healthy conditions for his pigs. 

Due to the lack of sufficient capital, he is now asking for a loan of USD 250. He will buy bricks and cement to build a brick piggery. This loan will help Phon’s hogs to grow healthier and thus bring a higher price upon distribution. 

He hopes to keep growing as a successful entrepreneur with his farm and backyard hog-raising business.

loans.use: to buy bricks and cement to build a brick piggery.

loans.name: Heap's Group

texts.en:
Heap is 28 years old and a mother of two, one boy and one girl. Both of her children are still in school. She and the family live in a wooden house located in Dambae district. 

To earn a living, Heap and her husband have been planting cassava and farming rice for over 10 years. 

Heap has been with VisionFund since 2008. The previous loans have enabled her to increase her income and afford her children’s school fees. Heap and another member of the group are now requesting another loan from VisionFund. As a leader, Heap plans to use a portion of her loan to pay the labor fee for her farmland, buy fertilizers and plant more cassava for selling. 

After this loan, she hopes that the price of cassava will increase so that she can sell them to generate more income to support her family.

loans.use: To pay the labor fee for her farmland, buy fertilizers and plant more cassava for selling.

loans.name: Oeun

texts.en:
Oeun is 23 years old and a single man who lives in Ang Snoul district, Kandal province. 

He works for a company in Phnom Penh city as a bus driver. He gets his payment monthly. 

Oeun doesn’t own any vehicle for traveling and he intends to buy one soon. However, due to the lack of capital, he would like to apply for a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a used motorcycle for personal use. 

This is his first loan from HKL and he is confident that he will pay his loan back regularly and punctually. He thanks in advance for your help.

loans.use: to purchase a used motorcycle.

loans.name: Madelyn

texts.en:
Madelyn is from San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. She is 30 years old, married, and has two children. 

Madelyn used her last loan to purchase a pedicab transport vehicle to improve her business. Her business has grown and become successful. 

Now, she's taking a new loan to purchase accessories and spare parts. She is optimistic that she will be able to grow her business more.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and spare parts for her pedicab.

location.town: San Carlos, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Fouad

texts.en:
Fouad is a 50-year-old married man, father of six children.

Fouad has been working in food business since 1995. His grocery store is going on just fine, but he needs more cash in order to add new products requested by customers.

Fouad applied for a Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua in order to increase his store's merchandise with special spring and summer beverages and snacks.

Fouad is a hard worker. This is his fifth cycle as an Al Majmoua borrower, and all his previous loans helped a lot in increasing his business and improving his social and financial situations.

He has a good paying back history with a very good reputation. Fouad hopes to expand his business more and more and to start a wholesale trade.

loans.use: To increase his store's merchandise with special spring and summer beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Jorenda

texts.en:
Jorenda is a married woman, having four children. Jorenda is 41 years old, residing at Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur, Philippines. 

Jorenda used her last loan to purchase additional products to sell. Her business has grown and become successful. 

Now she's taking a new loan to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee. Positively, she hopes to be able to grow  more her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like canned goods, noodles, sugar and coffee.

location.town: Sto. Niño, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn's main source of income comes from providing charcoal. She is 30 years old, married and has five children. They are from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. 

Jocelyn has been in her business for seven years and earns 6,000 GDMPC, which is used to to purchase materials needed to provide her service.

Jocelyn is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will again be used to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase coconut shells for charcoal making.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
As a married mother of seven children, Elisa works hard to support her family.

She has a fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from raising livestock. 

Elisa is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

Elisa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 17 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase feed such as polvillo (animal feed made from rice), corn, chicken feed, vitamins and vaccines to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Karim

texts.en:
Karim is a 24-year-old married man who has worked in furniture making since 2007. Karim is well known in his business because of the good quality of products he provides his customers.
 
Karim is a man with a very good reputation. He's talented in his business very much because he loves it.

To keep his business updated all the time, Karim applied for a youth loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua. He will buy necessary tools for his business and he will also buy necessary household appliances for his wife to make her life as a housewife easier.

Karim hopes to open a bigger furniture-making factory in the future.

loans.use: To buy necessary tools for his business.

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida is 56 years old. She is married and has four children.

Adelaida works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell.

Adelaida has borrowed and repaid four previous loans from NWTF. She has been running her general store for two years and also earns an income from her tricycle transport business.

Adelaida aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: To purchase more items to sell

loans.name: Takku Liguey Ikagel N° 2 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "TAKKU LIGUEY IKAGEL N° 2" se compose de 5 femmes.Elles travaillent toutes dans une usine de traitement de poisson frais. En plus de leur emploi, elles font du commerce de tissus et de produits cosmétiques qu'elles vendent à crédit auprès des autres femmes de l'usine.Cela leur rapporte des revenus supplémentaires qui leur permettent de subvenir à leurs propres besoins.Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 600000f pour acheter des tissus et des produits cosmétiques.Elles ambitionnent de faire des voyages de commerce dans les pays de la sous - région.
texts.en:
The group "TAKKU LIGUEY IKAGEL N° 2" consists of five women who work at a fresh fish processing plant. They also sell fabrics and cosmetic products on credit to other employees of the plant. This additional income allows them to support themselves. 

To strengthen their working capital, they are seeking a loan of 600,000F to buy fabrics and cosmetic products. They plan to travel to the sub-regions on business.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and cosmetic products for resale.

loans.name: Silvia Marina

texts.es:
Silvia Marina, tiene 39 años de edad, está casada y vive con su esposo y sus dos hijos de 12 y 16 años de edad en una colonia periférica de san Pedro Sula.
Hace 2 años y medio que estableció su propio negocio de comidas, ella tiene el negocio (cafetería) en su casa donde ofrece golosinas, refrescos, dulces y comidas. Anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa privada pero decidió establecer este negocio ya que es rentable. Ella quiere mantener siempre producto y variedad en su negocio para ofrecer a sus clientes, es el  tercer préstamo solicitado y con el va comprar productos para surtir la cafetería donde vende comida, refrescos, y golosinas.
Con las ganancias piensa buscar un local que sea más accesible para las ventas y mejorar así los ingresos familiares, apoyando a su esposo para lograr hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Silvia Marina is 39 years old, and she is married.  She lives with her husband and her two children, ages 12 and 16, in an outlying area of San Pedro Sula. 

She established her own food business two and a half years ago.  She has a business (café) in her house where she sells candy, soft drinks, sweets, and food.  She previously worked for a private company, but she decided to establish this business because it is profitable.

She always wants to have products and variety to offer her customers in her business.  This is her third requested loan.  She will use it to buy products to stock the café where she sells food, soft drinks, and sweets.

She is thinking of using the earnings to look for a place that would be more accessible for sales.  This way she would improve the family income.  She would be supporting her husband in order to manage to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to stock food products like soft drinks, churros, sweets, and supplies to make food.

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en:
Jessie is married with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Jessie is 46 years old and has two children who are in school.

Jessie has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jessie has requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell at her food stall.

She has been in this business for 20 years. Jessie would like to save enough money to ensure a secure future for her family.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell at her food stall

loans.name: Janit

texts.en: Janit's main source of income comes from providing trisikad (pedicab) services in her community. She is 25 years old, married, and has three children. They are from Militar, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Janit has been in her business for seven years and earns 3,000 PHP a month. In 2009, Janit joined GDMPC. Janit is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to repair a trisikad (pedicab)

loans.name: Nayila

texts.en: Nayila is a married woman with three children between the ages of 21 and 24. She has been engaged in agriculture for the past 28 years. She sells cheese, milk, butter, and other dairy products. Her husband is a pensioner and also helps to support their family. Nayila has applied for a loan of 700 AZN to make repairs at their house. Her husband will buy the construction materials.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to make house repairs.

loans.name: José Rubén

texts.es:
El joven José Rubén es originario de una comarca aledaña al municipio de El Sauce, se desempeña como Guarda de seguridad, actividad que le permite llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar y darles lo mejor que puede a sus hijos.
Como padre responsable lucha día a día para ser cada día un mejor trabajador y cumplir con sus obligaciones por lo que en este momento necesita un crédito como complemento para adquirir una motocicleta con el fin de trasladarse a su centro de trabajo y llegar puntual, ya que su vivienda queda alejada de la ciudad.
Tiene cuatro años de trabajar con ceprodel donde le han otorgado cuatro créditos todos le han beneficiado en su hogar.
Espera y confía en Dios que su solicitud sea aprobada y poder adquirir este vehículo para trasladarse a su centro de trabajo.
texts.en:
The young José Rubén is originally from an area on the outskirts of the munipality of El Sauce. He’s a security guard, which allows him to take home the daily bread and give his children the best he can.
As a responsible father, he fights day to day to be a better worker and meet his obligations. At this time, he is a requsting a loan to buy a motorcycle so he can get to work on time, as his home is far from the city. 
He’s been working with Ceprodel for 4 years and has received 4 loans previousbsly, which have all benefitted his household.
He hopes and confides in God that his request will be approved so he can get himself to work.

loans.use: buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 61 years old, married, and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. Teresita has requested a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store (variety store).

Teresita has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from running a carinderia (restaurant).

Teresita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: And Bollo De Diamaguene 1 Group

texts.fr: Le groupe "AND BOLLO DE DIAMAGUENE 1" se compose de cinq femmes mariées. Elles mènent des activités de commerce de tissus, de produits cosmétiques et de denrées alimentaires.Elles parviennent à obtenir des bénéfices qui leur permettent de prendre en charge certaines dépenses d'entretien de leurs familles mais également leurs propres besoins. Afin de renforcer leur fonds de commerce, elles sollicitent un pret de 500000f pour acheter des denrées alimentaires, des produits cosmétiques ainsi que des tissus.Elles ambitionnent de s'engager dans le commerce en gros qu'elles jugent plus rentable.
texts.en: The « And Bollo de Diamaguene 1 » group is composed of five married woman. They sell fabric, cosmetic products and staple foods. They manage to earn in income allowing them to provide for certain ongoing family expenses as well as for their personal needs. In order to bolster their working capital, they are seeking a loan of 500,000 West African francs in order to buy staple foods, cosmetics and fabric. Their goal is to start selling wholesale, which they believe to be more profitable.

loans.use: to buy staple foods, cosmetics and fabric.

loans.name: María Etanislada

texts.es:
La Joven María Etanislada actualmente es asalariada, donde desempeña el cargo de Administradora Auxiliar, ella tiene  un espíritu de superación en la vida, cuenta con un hijo a su cargo,  tuvo la oportunidad de conocer  por primera vez  Ceprodel que apoya a las personas para mejorar sus vidas y las de su familia. 

Por esta razón,  se presentó para solicitar un crédito para la compra de cinc, Perlines y Ladrillo, para el bienestar  de ella y la de su familia, de igual manera espera en Dios que esta institución le pueda ayudar, debido a que la  motiva a seguir luchando  esta muy agradecida ya que podrá  lograr vivir en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
María Etanislada is currently employed.  She works as an administrative assistant.   She has the spirit for improving herself in this life.  She has a child under her care.

She had the opportunity to learn, for the first time, about Ceprodel, and that it supports people so that they can improve their lives and those of their families.

That is the reason she came to request a loan to buy zinc sheeting, roof beams, and bricks.  She will do this for her well-being and that of her family.  She has hope in God that this institution is able to help her, as her motive is to keep striving to improve.

She is very grateful because she will be able to manage to live under better conditions.

loans.use: to buy zinc sheeting, roof beams, and bricks.

loans.name: Maimouna

texts.fr:
Maimouna , agè de 37 ans fait de la confection de draps depuis 10 ans. Elle est cèlibataire sans enfant. C' est une habituèe du guichet, elle est à son 3ème crèdit à l'IMCEC . Prèsentement,  elle sollicite un crèdit de 100000F CFA pour acheter de la matière première telle que du fil, du percale pour confectionner des draps de lit et les revendre sur le marchè. Pour un draps , il  faut  7 mètres de basin et/ou de percale selon le choix des clients et du fil.
Maimouna n' a pas de  charges et travaille pour amèliorer son commerce et augmenter son fond de roulement. Pour cela elle a besoin de l' appui d'une institution financière comme l'IMCEC.
texts.en:
Maimouna, age 37, has been making bed sheets for ten years. She is a single woman without children. She is a steady member of the local IMCEC branch, now on her third loan cycle. She is seeking 100,000F CFAF to buy supplies such as thread and percale to sew bed sheets for sale on the market. To make one sheet, she requires some thread and seven meters of bazin and/or percale, depending on the customer’s preference. 

Maimouna has no debts. She strives to improve her business and bolster her working capital, which is why she relies on the support of the IMCEC.

loans.use: to buy percale, bazins and thread to make bed sheets for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: build a room for his daughter.

loans.name: Esilda Enriqueta

texts.es:
Esilda es una mujer de 52 años que vive junto a su hijo y su esposo Sergio (un hombre de 57 años) en "Santo Domingo" que es una de las ciudades más jóvenes del país, actualmente se ha constituido en el punto de enlace entre las región Sierra y Costa del Ecuador. Es un sitio privilegiado, no solo por la riqueza étnica, sino también por los paisajes inusitados que se pueden encontrar desde el ingreso mismo a esta bella ciudad. Santo Domingo de los Colorados pertenece actualmente a la provincia de Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, recientemente conformada en el 2007. La fiesta principal de Santo Domingo, se celebra con un movimiento intenso de visitantes, intercambio comercial y cultural. Una gran feria tiene lugar en las instalaciones de la Asociación de Ganaderos, allí se muestran y compiten los mejores ejemplares de las distintas razas y cruces que son criados en las haciendas de la región. 

Esilda trabaja en una escuelita; ella está encargada del bar, en donde los niños compran alimentos y snacks para servirse a la hora de su recreo. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años y con este ingreso ella puede aportar económicamente a su hogar. Para este nuevo período escolar Esilda requiere un crédito con el cual pueda comprar la mercadería que venderá a los niños de la escuelita y así seguir aportando a su hogar.
Su sueño es poder tener una tiendita, con su propio local.
texts.en:
Esilda is 52 years old, and lives with her son and her husband Sergio, who is 57 years old. They live in Santo Domingo, which is one of the youngest cities in the country, and is located between the Sierra and Costa (mountain and coastal) regions of Ecuador. It is a privileged place, as it has a rich ethnic heritage and unique, beautiful geography and landscape. The city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados belongs to the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas, which was established recently in 2007. The main festival in Santo Domingo is celebrated every year, and many visitors arrive from all over for the event. There is great cultural and commercial exchange during the festival. A great fair also takes places at the facilities of the Ranchers Association, where representatives from various ranches compete and show their prize animals from each breed and cross breed.

Esilda works in a school, and she is responsible for the snack bar there, where the children can buy snacks during their recess time. She began working at the school three years ago, and with the income from this job, she can help support her household. For this new school year, Esilda is requesting a loan which she will use to help her purchase merchandise for resale at the snack bar. Her dream is to one day be able to open her own store.

loans.use: to purchase snacks for resale.

loans.name: Norma Isabel

texts.es:
Norma Isabel. Vive en el Municipio de Achuapa departamento de León, Es una joven dedicada a su trabajo, desempeña el cargo como contadora, cuenta con tres hijos a su cargo.

Cuenta con su propia vivienda y una  finca, el destino del crédito solicitado es para compra de alambre, para cercar   su propiedad, de igual manera Ceprodel Apoya a este Tipo de actividad ayudando a cumplir sus metas de tener un techo seguro ya que sin la ayuda de este financiamiento le seria más difícil realizarlo.   
De ante mano le esta muy agradecida a ceprodel por dicha colaboración que puedan brindarle ya que espera seguir trabajando con esta institución
texts.en:
Norma Isabel lives in the Municipality of Achuapa, Department of Leon. She is a young person who is dedicated to her work as an accountant. She has 3 children under her care.

Norma Isabel has her own house and some land. The requested loan will be used to buy wire fencing for securing her property. Ceprodel supports this type of activity, helping people achieve the goal of having a secure home. Without the aid of this financing, the task would be more difficult to accomplish.

Norma Isablel is very grateful to Ceprodel in advance for the collaboration it offers her, and she hopes to continue working with this institution.

loans.use: buy wire fencing to secure her property.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité  María Auxiliadora tiene 16 integrantes donde todas ellas se esfuerzan siempre y trabajan todas juntas. Es un grupo destacado en el barrio ya que siempre trabajan juntas y de esa forma se ayudan en sus metas y objetivos.
Leonida es la presidenta, y es ella quien siempre orienta a sus amigas a poder trabajar juntas y a no rendirse y luchar por lo que quieren. Leonida tiene un copetín y con esto mantiene a su familia y les da lo que necesitan para una vida digna y sin privaciones.
Ella solicitó el crédito para la compra de galletitas, gaseosas, golosinas y demás productos con los cuales quiere surtir y de esa forma darle buena variedad a sus clientes. Ella y sus compañeras agradecen la oportunidad que están recibiendo de Kiva y fundación paraguaya.
texts.en:
The María Auxiliadora group has sixteen members all of whom make a great effort and work hard together. The group is well-known in the neighbourhood for their mutual support which helps them reach their goals and objectives.

Leonida is the president. She is the person who guides the group so they work together, do not become discouraged, and fight to achieve what they want. She runs a small cafe, and with the income from it she supports her family and provides them with the necessities for a simple but painless life.

Leonida is seeking a loan to buy cookies, soft drinks, candy and other products so she has a good variety to offer her customers. She and her friends are grateful for this opportunity from Kiva and the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy cookies, soft drinks, candy etc.

loans.name: Vya Raity Group

texts.es:
Vya raity es el grupo que se formó en la ciudad de luque, con 15 mujeres de esa ciudad. Todas ellas son amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad y comentan que se unieron para trabajar juntas y asi poder mejorar las condiciones de ellas y sus familias.
La Sra. Marta se dedica a la venta de helados y tambien los fines de semana a la venta de comestibles, tiene 1 hijo todavia menor de edad. Cuenta ella que todo el esfuerzo que hace es por su hijo, ya que quiere darle lo que necesite para poder estudiar y de esa forma ser una persona de bien, que sirva a los demás.
Ella solicita el credito  para la compra de helados y productos para la elaboracion de comestibles, ella tiene como meta abrir un negocio mas amplio y elevar sus venta asi.
texts.en:
The Vya Raity group is made up of 15 women from the city of Luque, all of whom are friends and neighbors from the community. They formed this group in order to be able to work together and improve their quality of life and the quality of life for their families. 

Marta makes a living selling ice cream and, on the weekends, sells other food items. She has one young son who is her motivation for working hard, since she desires to provide all she can for him and for his future. She hopes to help him grow into a good and deep person who serves others.

She is requesting this loan in order to purchase ice cream and other input items to use in making food and various dishes. Her goal is to grow her business and increase her sales.

loans.use: to purchase ice cream and other products for making food.

loans.name: Nael

texts.en:
