Lory works hard to support her family. She is single and has a tricycle transportation business in the Philippines.

Lory requested a loan of 18,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy motor oil and to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle. She has been in this business for 4 years.

In the future, Lory would like to save enough money to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy motor oil and to pay for the maintenance of her tricycle.

loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en:
Byambaa is a-29-year-old married guy who has one son and lives with his family in outer ger district which lacks basic infrastructure of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. 

Since, last year he has been managing to build a small public dormitory at outer ger district. And when the dormitory is ready done, he plans to rent it, it has 16 rooms and he can rent it to 16 different people. His spouse really hopes that the family can increase their family income by renting this small dormitory. 

But Byambaa didn’t finished interior section of this building, so he is requesting a 1.000.000 Mongolian Tugriks (MNT) loan to purchase construction materials to finish interior side of his dormitory. As young guy, he is very hardworking and ambitious guy who really wishes to live happily with his family.

loans.use: to finish building a dormitory

loans.name: Sulficia

texts.en:
As a widowed mother of 5 children, Sulficia works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Sulficia is borrowing PHP 30000 through NWTF to buy a new engine for her fishing business.

Sulficia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase a new engine and repair her fishing boat.

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl works hard to support her family. Cheryl is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Cheryl requested a PHP 22000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance.

Cheryl has been in this business for 2 years now.

In the future, Cheryl would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Shirley

texts.en:
Shirley is married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Shirley is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

Shirley has a personal products sales business in the Philippines. Shirley requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more personal products to sell to customers.

Shirley has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Shirley would like to save money to expand her business and send her children her children to school.

loans.use: to buy more personal products to sell to customers.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is married with 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Cristina is 52 years old and has one child who is in school.

Cristina has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Cristina requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional stocks of fish to sell.

Cristina has been in this business for 6 years. In the future, Cristina would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional stocks of fish to sell

loans.name: Sokha's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of Dambae district where common business is planting cassava, Sokha and her husband have been planting this kind of crop and farming rice for ten years. She is 28 years old and has three children, all of whom are still in school. From the business, her family earns around four US dollars per day. Sokha after completely paying all her previous obligation to VisionFund, is now requesting a fourth loan. As a leader, she plans to use a portion of the loan to plant more cassava and grow more rice. With this loan, she hopes to generate more income for the family and send all her children to school until graduated.

loans.use: To plant more cassava and grow more rice

loans.name: Nidal

texts.en: Nidal is a 19-year-old who lives in Gaza in a very commercial city. He has a grocery store and earns approximately $464 each month doing this type of work. He has requested a youth loan in the amount of $1500 to purchase a refrigerator, shelves, and electricity generator. Nidal hopes to improve his living conditions with his additional profit.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator, shelves, and electricity generator for his mini market.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La socia Irma nació en la ciudad de Anta y vive en misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene cuatro hijos. Su actividad económica principal de la socia Irma es la venta de productos  de primera necesidad como por ejemplo sacos de arroz, sacos de azúcar y otras cosas más. Irma también se dedica a la venta de verduras y crianza de animales menores como cuyes y gallinas.  Irma requiere el préstamo para comprar más productos de primera necesidad como por ejemplo sacos de arroz y sacos de azúcar.   
  
La socia Irma pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta” de la Asociación Arariwa de la provincia del Cusco.
texts.en:
Irma was born in the city of Anta and lives in the city in which she was born.  She has four children.  Her main business activity is selling basic household products such as bags of rice, sugar, and other products.  Irma also sells vegetables and raises animals such as guinea pigs and hens.  She needs this loan to buy more basic household products such as sacks of rice and sugar.  

Irma is a member of Asociación Arariwa's "Virgen Inmaculada Concepción de Anta community bank in Cusco province.

loans.use: to buy more basic household products

loans.name: Moisés

texts.es:
Moisés tiene 42 años, es un hombre muy responsable que vive en compañía de Natalia, su esposa, desde hace 20 años. Tienen dos hijos menores: Abel y Angelis, a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Batanyacu. 

Desde muy joven se dedicó a la construcción, su oficio de albañil le sirvió para obtener todo lo necesario para subsistir. Pero hace poco sufrió un accidente quedando, desde entonces, enyesado y con un clavo en la pierna. A raíz de ello comenzó a vender dulces en la escuela de su localidad, donde obtiene lo necesario para sobrevivir. Y Por las noches cuida el almacén del colegio donde vive, de ello obtiene un sueldo mensual. Sabe que muy pronto mejorará y podrá retomar el oficio que le gusta y que le dejaba buenos ingresos para su hogar. 
Por otro lado, su esposa vende zapatillas por catálogo a los pobladores de su zona, junto a Moisés se turnan para poder vender con mayor rapidez. 

Éste es su primer préstamo con MFP, agradece el apoyo que le brindan, ya que adquiere el capital de trabajo que necesita para poder trabajar y progresar en su negocio. Además, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que los integrantes de su asociación son personas solidarias y responsables.
Moisés invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de dulces y bebidas, así como zapatillas para su venta.
texts.en:
Moisés, 42, is a very responsible man living with Natalia, his wife, for the last 20 years.  They have two minor children, Abel and Angelis, who they care for in his own house located in Batanyacu.

From a very young age he worked in construction as a bricklayer; it gave him everything he needed to subsist.  But a short time ago he had an accident and since then his leg has had a pin in it and it’s in a cast.  As a result of this he started selling candy in his local school where he earns what’s necessary to survive.  At night, he guards the store at the school where he lives and earns a monthly salary doing that.  He knows that he’ll get better soon and will be able to resume the occupation he likes and that produced good household income.  On the other hand, his wife sells slippers via catalogue to residents in his zone.  She and Moisés take turns in order to sell more quickly.

This is his first MFP loan and he is grateful for the support he’s getting because he gets working capital he needs to be able to work and make progress in his business.  He promises to be punctual with his installment payments since all the members of his association are supportive, responsible people.

Moisés will use the requested money to buy candy and soft-drinks as well as slippers to sell.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Julio Frankly

texts.es:
Julio tiene 33 años, es padre de 2 pequeño a los cuales quiere muchísimo, por razones ajenas se separo de su esposa pero ello no ha impedido que el vea a sus hijos y más aun le dé su amor de padre y colabore con la madre de ellos en la crianza, día a día el se esfuerza mucho porque quiere que sus hijos se sientan orgullosos de el y sobre todo porque quiere darle una vida feliz. Vive en casa de sus padres, quienes son agricultores y a quienes también ayuda, Su vivienda se ubica en la ciudad de Imperial, en esta ciudad se desarrolla la agricultura sobre todo el cultivo de algodón, maíz, entre otros, asimismo tienen playas hermosas y sobre todo por la amabilidad de sus pobladores. Julio trabaja en su negocio como chofer de taxi y ya lleva trabajando alrededor de 10 años, su padre fue quien le enseño a manejar y quien lo animo a tener este tipo de trabajo ya que el tenia un auto y se lo dio para que trabaje, Julio poco a poco fue arreglando el vehículo con el fruto de su trabajo y también apoya a sus padres; el cree que le va bien en su negocio porque es muy amable y porque tiene muchos ánimos de salir adelante.

Julio está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar un mantenimiento general a su vehículo, en especial realizarle una revisión al motor, de esta manera tendrá un vehículo en buen estado para poder trabajar y dar seguridad  a sus clientes; así el podrá seguir trabajando para hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Darle una buena educación a sus hijos y comprar un auto nuevo”.
texts.en:
Julio, 33, is the father of two little ones he loves very much.  For reasons beyond his control he separated from his wife but this has not kept him from seeing his children or from giving them his fatherly love or in collaborating with their mother in raising them.

Day to day he strives very much because he wants his children to be proud of him and above all because he wants to give them a happy life.  He lives in his parents’ house; they are farmers and he also helps them.  His house is located in the city of Imperial.  Agriculture takes place in this city, especially cotton and corn growing, among others.  It also has beautiful beaches and its residents are very kind.

Julio works as a taxi driver and has been so doing for about 10 years.  His father taught him to drive and encouraged him to go into this type of business since he had a car and gave it to him so that he could work.  Julio gradually fixed the car with the fruits of his labor and he also supports his parents.  He believes that he does well in his business because he’s very kind and because he very much wants to get ahead.

Julio is very grateful to Kiva lenders because thanks to the help they’ve given him he will be able to service his vehicle, especially check out the engine, so that he’ll have a car in good condition to work and provide security for his customers so that he can continue working toward making his greatest dream a reality: to give his children a good education and to buy a new car.

loans.use: to service his vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower has worked as a kindergarten teacher for many years. In addition, she rents rooms in her house in order to earn extra income. She used her last loan to make repairs to her house so that the rooms will be more comfortable for lodgers. A new loan will help her continue construction and repairs on her house.

The borrower is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Hatunchaskas" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: to finish construction on rooms that she rents

loans.name: Prum

texts.en: Prum is 69 years old and a single parent who is responsible for five children, living in Kampong Chhnang province, Cambodia. She has spent most her lifetime dedicated to rice farming business. She owns a few hectares of land for transplanting rice. She has some of her children help her in the business every year. Aside from this business, she owns and operates a small store for selling grocery items to local people in and around her commune. And recently, one of her children also is involved in the business of selling grocery items in a market of Phnom Penh. Due to the needs of capital to renovate and enlarge her daughter’s store, Prum would like to take out a loan of KHR 3,000,000 to support her daughter in expanding her store. This loan will enable the family to financially sustain and upgrade their living standard.

loans.use: to renovate and enlarge a store for her daughter.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is married with six children. Juliet is 55 years old and lives in Pelong, Aloran, Misamis Occidental.
To earn a living, Juliet has a Vehicle Repair Shop where her husband is the technician & have also a general store business. She has had this business for 2 years. Each month, she earns approximately PHP 5000 respectively. Juliet has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.In the future, Juliet hopes to earn more savings someday.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her Vehicle Repair shop

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora is 63 years old and widowed with 3 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Leonora runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell.

Leonora has been in this business for 13 years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap, coffee, sardines, etc.. 

In the future Leonora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase more stocks to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn requested a PHP 13000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.

Jocelyn has been in this business for 12 years.

In the future, she would like to save enough to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, snack foods and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Lyuba

texts.en:
Lyuba has run fruits and vegetables trading business for 5 years. Lyuba’s husband helps her in business and thanks to joint effort they are able to provide their family. Also thanks to business Lyuba bought necessary furniture for her family. Lyuba needs a 1.000.000 Armenian dram loan to buy a car which will allow Lyuba and her husband to bring fruits and vegetables for their business from Tavush region villages and from wholesale markets of Yerevan as well. Now Lyuba and her husband buy merchandise once a week and the car will allow them to bring merchandise for their business every day. From Yerevan Lyuba brings only apples and bananas; other fruits, vegetables and berries Lyuba buys from villagers in Tavush region villages. She runs her business at food market.    
Lyuba is 33 years old. She lives in Ijevan city with her husband, two school aged children and mother-in-low. Her mother-in-low works as a seamstress and Lyuba worked as a seamstress with her several years ago.

loans.use: to buy a car which will allow Lyuba to bring fruits and vegetables for her business

loans.name: Catalina

texts.en:
Catalina is 65 years old and lives in Silang Cavite, Philippines. She is widowed, and a mother of four children, three of whom are already working.  She works hard to provide for their daily expenses.

Catalina makes a living by selling Ornamental plants, which are plants that are grown for decorative purposes in gardens and landscape design projects, as houseplants. She’s been in the business for twenty five years. She earns a minimum of Php250 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting for a loan of Php 30,000. She will be using the money to buy things needed for planting such as, fertilizer, pots, seedlings. She expects a boost in her income as she expands her business. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for raw materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a mother of five children, four of whom are in school. She has been selling coconuts as retail for the past nine years, selling to customers from the nearby market. Other sources of income include sales from farm produce. Mwanasha owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes high transport costs to be her major challenge and school fees to be her greatest monthly expense. She joined Yehu to get access to loans.
With the loan of KES 50,000, she intends to purchase coconuts for sale and prepare her garden for planting.

loans.use: to purchase coconuts for sale and prepare her garden for planting.

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Monica is married with three children. All of her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members. She has the business of selling African attires. She has applied for a loan of  700,000 Ugandan Shilling from MCDT SACCO to buy more African attire. She has been in this business for seven years and sells in a rented shop. She works six days a week. Monica aspires to see her business grow big so that she can start importing African attire from the Democratic Republic of Congo (DRC) and also build her own house. Her business challenges include seasonality and transportation. She resides in a home that she rents and the family doesn’t have access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more African attire to sell.

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.en:
Alphonse is 26 years old and is single. He sells various goods such as: cooking oil, soap, sugar, rice, biscuits etc and he has two years of experience in this business. Alphonse starts his business from 7 a.m to 7 p.m every day per week. 

Alphonse has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as: cooking oil, soap, sugar, rice, biscuits etc to sell. With any profits, he will be able to save for his future, and he will be able to re-invest in his business.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: cooking oil, soap, sugar, rice, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Luz

texts.es:
Luz tiene 27 años, vive en compañía de Renzo, su esposo, desde hace 10 años. Tienen tres hijos menores a los que cuidan en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Batanyacu.
Desde las primeras horas de la mañana, se dedica a la venta de zapatillas por catálogos, cuenta que es muy trabajoso caminar por horas pero, como es una mujer trabajadora afronto el reto con mucha decisión, apenas 2 meses que comenzó con la venta, espera poder tener mucho éxito con ello. Por su parte su esposo se dedica a la venta de repuesto para carro y baterías, en una zona céntrica de la ciudad, ya tiene muchos años dedicándose a este oficio, por ello espera muy pronto tener su propia tienda de repuestos donde puede vender sus productos y así tener un negocio propia para el futuro de él y su familia.

Ella pertenece al grupo solidario “las mujeres del éxito” y este es el primer préstamo con MFP, agradece el apoyo que le brindan, ya que adquiere el capital de trabajo que necesita para poder trabajar y progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que los integrantes de su asociación son personas solidarias y responsables.
Luz invertirá el dinero solicitado; una parte en la compra de zapatillas, y otra en el pago de la pensión escolar de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Luz, 27, lives with Renzo, her husband of ten years.  They have three minor children they care for in her own house located in Batanyacu.

Starting the first hours of the morning, she sells sandals via catalogue.  She relates that it’s very demanding to walk for hours but since she’s a hardworking woman she faced the challenge firmly.  She started the sales just two months ago and she hopes to have much success with it.  On his part, her husband works selling auto spare parts and batteries in a centrally-located part of the city; he has many years’ experience in this occupation so hopes to have his own spare parts store soon to sell his products and have a business for his and his family’s future.

She belongs to the “Las Mujeres Del Éxito” (Women of Success) communal bank and this is the first MFP loan.  She is grateful for the support she’s getting because she acquires the working capital she needs to work and to make business progress.  She also promises to be punctual with her installment payments because the members of her association are supportive, responsible people.

Luz will use part of the requested money to buy sandals and the other part to pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: to buy sandals and pay school fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This member is in his late 70s and married with five children. His profession is in accounting and he used to work in the public sector. He used his last loan to pay some business debts that he previously acquired. At this time, the member would like to improve his house and a loan will help him pay for repairs and renovation.

The member is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Hatunchaskas" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: To renovate his house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The borrower is 48 and continues his carpentry business where he makes beds, armoires, and shelving among other products. He produces made-to-order furniture following his customers' specifications. He used his last loan to buy materials such as wood and tapestries for his business. A new loan will allow him to buy more materials and continue fulfilling his customers' orders. The borrower has two children with his partner.

The borrower is receiving an individual loan as a member of the village bank "Hatunchaskas" in Cusco, which is located in the South Andean region of Peru. The bank is in its third cycle with Asociación Arariwa.

loans.use: To buy wood and tapestries to make furniture

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is 37 years old and is married with three children aged between 5 and 12 years old. She owns a decoration business and she has five years of experience in this work and she currently employs three people to help her. Farida`s business starts form 8 a.m to 5 p.m every day per week. 

Farida has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her decoration business by buying different materials to use in the weeding. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future, she will be able to pay school fees for her children and she will be able to re-invest in her business.

loans.use: To expand her decoration business by buying different materials to use in the weeding.

loans.name: Jocyln

texts.en:
Jocyln is 35 years old and lives in Mangidkid, PLaridel . She is married with two children. 
To earn a living, Jocyln has a grocery store business. She earns about PHP 10,000 each month doing this type of work. Jocyln has a requested a loan of 15000 to purchase sardines, cooking oil, noodles, sugar, and other grocery items.
Jocyln has been a member of PMPC for 1 year.  In the future, Jocyln would like to success in her new business.

loans.use: To purchase sardines, cooking oil, noodles, sugar and other grocery items

loans.name: Hanzal

texts.en:
Hanzal is a 27-year-old single man, who has been working in his grocery store since 2000. His store is necessary in his village since they don't have malls or wider stores.
Hanzal is benefiting from this opportunity to expand his business through increasing his merchandise by applying for a Youth Loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, this loan will help him provide his customers with special spring & summer beverages, in addition to tobacco which is the main product he is aiming to purchase.
Hanzal is a hard worker, he is planning to expand his business more and more through whole sale trade in the future.
Hanzal has a very good reputation, he works hard on preserving it as much as he can.
With his good standing history as Al Majmoua borrower for three cycles, Hanzal has a good chance to expand his future loans a lot.

loans.use: To increase his business merchandise with special spring & summer beverages

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 46 years old and lives in Senote, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental. She is married with three children. 
Lourdes has a store that sells a variety of products like soft drinks, cooking oils, bread, biscuits, candies, and many others.  She has had this business for four (4) years. She requested a loan of 49,000 to purchase more stocks for her general store.
Lourdes has been a member of PMPC for nine years.  In the future, Lourdes hopes to own a house & lot someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks for her general store

loans.name: Hannington

texts.en:
Hannington is a single man who has been operating a tailoring business for the last 13 years, serving and selling finished clothes to the local residents. In addition, he sells coconuts which provide him with another source of income. Hannington lives in his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He dreams of opening a tailor training institute in future. He states that some of his customers take a long time before they collect their ordered clothes which affects his business. He joined Yehu to get loans.
With the loan of KES 50,000, he plans to purchase clothing materials and a stock of coconuts for sale.

loans.use: to purchase clothing materials and a stock of coconuts for sale.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is married with five children and all her children go to school and she also takes care of additional family members. She has business of selling of bananas and sells to all categories of people but on retail. She has been in this banana business for 9 years. She has applied for loan of 600000 Ugandan shillings from MCDTSACCO to buy more bunches of bananas. Besides this bananas business she also generates additional income from selling charcoal. She works six days a week.  Her major business challenges include seasonality and thieves. She is aspiring of seeing her business grow big so that she starts going to villages for bananas and also to educate her children up to university. 
She resides in her own house and the family doesn’t have access to electricity and piped water.   Her monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas

loans.name: Augustin

texts.en:
Augustin is 32 years old and is married with one child who is 13 years old. He sells various goods such as: biscuits, juice, water, sugar, cakes, cooking oil etc and he has three years of experience in this business. Augustin currently employs one person to help him and his business is open from 6.30 a.m to 7 p.m every day per week. 

Augustin has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as: biscuits, juice, water, sugar, cakes, cooking oil etc to sell. With any profits, he will be able to re-invest in his business, and he will be able to buy a house for his family.

loans.use: To purchase various goods such as: biscuits, juice, water, sugar, cakes, cooking oil etc to sell.

loans.name: Chanthon's Group

texts.en:
Aged 40 years old, Chanthon is a mother of four children and lives in a rural area of the Ponhea Krek district. She has two daughters and two sons and some of them are working as garment workers for pay to hep support the family. She is a peasant who plants cassava as primary source of family's income and she supplements her income by selling grocery to gain extra income. She has been in her primary business for ten years to make a living. 

Chanthon has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles and she completely paid back the past loans which has helped her increase her family's income. She currently earns around 169,900 KHR from her current business. With her successful business, she is now leading the other two villagers who has been with VisionFund for from one to three loan cycles to apply for another loan with VisionFund for their respective purposes. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to increase her cassava crops and earn a larger income.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Ey's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village located in the Dambae district, Ey is aged 39 years old and married with four children, one daughter and three sons. Some of her children are still in school. To make a living, Ey has been farming rice on the two-hectare farmland and planting cassava on three hectare of farmland for almost twenty years. The main challenge for her family's business is the drop of cassava price. 

This is Ey's group loan with VisionFund and she and her group member have been with VisinoFund for three loan cycles. The past loans have enabled her to support her family and send and keep her children in school. With her current business, she can make daily income of 25,000 KHR and save around 15,000 each day for the future needs. With the financial need for her business, she is applying for a loan with her member and she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland. She hopes to make more crop yields and sell for good price so as to make a living better.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland

loans.name: Rayda

texts.es:
Rayda tiene 24 años, vive en compañía de Manuel, su esposo. Tienen cuatro hijos, todos pequeños. La casa donde viven es alquilada, ubicada en la localidad de Batanyacu.
Su trabajo diario consiste en la venta de zapatillas y productos de belleza por catálogo. Ya es muy conocida entre los pobladores de su zona, por eso reciben los artículos que comercializa con confianza. Asimismo, desde hace 4 años comenzó a vender casacas de cuero, lencería y camisas, en esto tiene clientes fijos. Ella es muy dedicada a su trabajo, siempre ocupada y con el espíritu de salir adelante. Por ello espera dentro de muy poco tener su propio negocio de pintado de carros, porque su esposo trabaja en eso para una empresa.”Ese negocio es rentable y ahorrando capital, abriré uno propio”, afirma.

Ella pertenece al grupo “Las mujeres del éxito” y éste es su primer préstamo con MFP. Agradece el apoyo que le brindan, ya que adquiere el capital de trabajo que necesita para poder trabajar y progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que los integrantes de su asociación son personas solidarias y responsables.
Rayda invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de camisas y casacas para su venta.
texts.en:
Rayda, 24, lives with Manuel, her husband.   They have four children, all small.  The house they live in is rented and located in Batanyacu.

Her daily work consists in selling sandals and beauty supplies via catalogue.  She is very well-known among the residents in her zone which is why they receive the goods she sells with confidence.  She also started selling leather jackets, lingerie and shirts four years ago and has regular customers for them.  She is very dedicated to her work; she’s always busy and with the drive to get ahead.  Because of this she hopes very soon to have her own auto painting business because that’s what her husband works at for a firm.  “That business is profitable and by saving capital I will open one of my own,” she affirms.

She belongs to the “Las Mujeres Del Éxito” (Women of Success) group and this is her first MFP loan.  She is grateful for the support she’s getting because she acquires the working capital she needs to work and make business progress.  She promises to be punctual with her installment payments because the members of her association are supportive, responsible people.

Rayda will use the requested money to buy shirts and jackets to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es:
Soledad tiene 31 años, vive en compañía de Percy, su esposo, desde hace 10 años. Tienen dos hijos, a los que cuida en una casa alquilada ubicada en la localidad de Batanyacu.
Su negocio es la venta de carne de pollo. Todas las madrugadas, comienza su trabajo separando por tamaño, clase y calidad. Junto a su esposo, trasladan la carne a los diferentes restaurantes, tiendas, supermercados y otros lugares donde la vendan. Este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que es una de los pocos distribuidores de la zona, y como hace entrega al negocio, con este servicio obtiene muchos clientes fijos. 
Adicionalmente, por la noche vende hamburguesas y frituras en la puerta de su casa, con lo que obtiene ganancias extras. 
Con el deseo de incrementar sus ganancias, en un futuro cercano, piensa criar ella misma los pollos para vender la carne y de esa manera no tendrá que comprar a otras granjas. También empezará a criar cuyes, ya que su carne se consume mucho en su zona.

Ella pertenece al grupo “Las mujeres del éxito” y éste es el primer préstamo con MFP, agradece el apoyo que le brindan, ya que adquiere el capital de trabajo que necesita para poder trabajar y progresar en su negocio. Además promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que los integrantes de su asociación son personas solidarias y responsables.
Soledad invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de más pollos para vender su carne.
texts.en:
Soledad, 31, lives with Percy, her husband of ten years.  They have two children she cares for in a rented house in Batanyacu.

Her business is selling chicken.  Every dawn she starts her work separating it by size, kind and quality.  Together with her husband she takes the meat to various restaurants, stores, supermarkets and other places where it’s sold.  This is a very profitable business because she's one of the few suppliers in the zone and since she delivers to the businesses this service yields many regular customers. In addition, at night she sells hamburgers and fried fast food at her doorstep thus obtaining extra profits.

With the aim of increasing profits she plans for the near future to start raising the chickens herself to sell the meat and this way not have to buy them from other farms.  She will also start to raise guinea pigs since guinea pig meat is consumed very much in her zone.

She belongs to the “Las Mujeres Del Éxito” (Women of Success) group and this is her first MFP loan.  She is grateful for the support she’s getting because she acquires the working capital she needs to work and make business progress.  She promises to be punctual with her installment payments because the members of her association are supportive, responsible people.

Soledad will use the requested money to buy more chickens to sell their meat.

loans.use: to buy chickens.

loans.name: Amalya

texts.en:
Amalya is still running her business selling women’s and children’s clothes, food, household goods and trinkets. She buys the clothes, trinkets and household goods in Yerevan once a week, while she purchases food from suppliers everyday. Thanks to her business income Amalya provides for herself, has bought furniture for her apartment, and recently repaired her apartment.

Amalya used her first Kiva loan to buy clothes and household goods for her business. She is now requesting a 1,000,000 AMD loan to buy tank tops, T-shirts, shorts, flip-flops, canned food, candy, beverages and household goods for her business.

loans.use: to buy tank tops, T-shirts, shorts, flip-flops, canned food, candy, beverages, and household goods for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more basic needs such as rice, oil and sugar to sell

loans.name: Rano

texts.ru: Рано замужняя женщина и на воспитании имеет одну дочку и троих сыновей. Муж является фермером, а Рано более 12 лет занимается пошивом женской одежды и вышиванием бисером. Она начала свою деятельность с одной швейной машинки, которая досталась ей от матери. Рано намерена закупить швейные машины с целью расширения бизнеса и рабочих мест. С этой целью она обращается к вам за вашу помощь.
texts.en: Rano is a married woman, who is raising one daughter and three sons.  Her husband is a farmer, and Rano has been involved in sewing women's clothing and embroidering with beads for over 12 years.  She started her business with one sewing machine, which was left to her by her mother.  Rano intends to buy sewing machines in order to expand her business and work spaces.  This is why she is coming to you for your help.

loans.use: to buy sewing machines

loans.name: Ma. Theresa

texts.en:
Ma. Theresa is married with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and has three children who are in school.

Ma. Theresa has a sari-sari (variety) store business in the Philippines. Ma. Theresa requested a loan of 15,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soft drinks, coffee, and sugar.

Ma. Theresa has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to have a mini grocery at the public market.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soft drinks, coffee, and sugar.

loans.name: Husen

texts.ru: Хусен работает поваром в чайхане (столовой) в своем сельсовете почти 10 лет. Он готовит всеми любимый плов. Все кто пробовал его блюдо приходят опять обедать в его столовую. Каждый день  мужчины собираются в чайхане, что бы побеседовать друг с другом и заказывают их любимое блюдо.На полученный кредит Хусен хочет полностью обнавить куханный инаннтарь в своей столовой и закупить несколько мешков риса.Он сотрудничает  с нашей организацией 8 лет, и благодарен за финансовую поддержку. За период нашего сотрудничества он приобрел машину и улучшил свои условия проживания. Он очень балгодарен за финансовую поддержку от КИВА.
texts.en: Husen has been working as a cook at a chaihan (cafe) in the village council for almost ten years.  He cooks the loved-by-everyone plov.  Everyone, who tasted his dish, come back to dine at his cafe.  Every day, men gather at the chaihan to talk to each other and order their favorite dishes.  Husen wants to use this loan to completely renew the kitchen supplies in the cafe and buy several bags of rice.  He has been partnering with our organization for eight years and is grateful for the financial support.  During the period of this partnership, he bought a car and improved his living conditions.  Husen is very grateful for the financial support from KIVA.

loans.use: to buy kitchen supplies and rice

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is taking out another loan of Ksh 50,000 to invest in her boutique. With this loan, she plans to purchase clothes and beauty items for her boutique. 

The previous loan enabled her to expand her business and start a boutique. She says that she is progressing well and that she aspires to hire employees in the future to assist her in the day-to-day core in her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes and beauty items for her boutique.

loans.name: Cleofelina Maria

texts.es: Cleofelina de 44 años de edad vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla, donde se dedica a la tradicional actividad de confeccionar ropa; ella se ha especializado en uniformes escolares y poco a poco ha logrado una clientela de instituciones educativas, con la que gradualmente ha ganado su reconocimiento. Su idea de negocio inició desde el año 2010, cuando una amiga la impulsó a emprender su aventura de negocio, pues conocía que había adquirido experiencia trabajando desde sus 20 años en diversas fábricas de confecciones. Sus principales líneas de productos son disfraces, uniformes, ropa escolar, deportiva y de diario, su meta mas adelante es estructurarlo muy bien para lograr generar ingresos superiores y empleos para sus hijos. Su mayor desafío es que su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para poder ampliar su negocio, comprando  herramientas y equipos, cada vez mas tecnificados y esto es justamente,  lo que resolverá con su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará  una máquina de confección, con la cual mejorara su proceso productivo y con ello la calidad de sus trabajos especialmente de sus disfraces y uniformes, con los que quiere impactar el mercado y acceder a nuevos y mas exigentes clientes. Su potencial de éxito radica en su conocimiento del mercado, de la técnica y en que mejorará los tiempos productivos los cuales representan dinero y calidad en la entrega y el acabado.
texts.en:
Cleofelina is 44 years old and lives in the city of Barranquilla, where she engages in the traditional activity of making clothes. She specializes in school uniforms and has gradually built up a clientele of educational institutions. As a a result, she has earned recognition. The idea for her business was conceived in 2010 when a friend convinced her to start her own business since had already acquired 20 years of experience working in various sewing factories. Her main product lines include dresses, uniforms, school clothes, sportswear, and daily wear. Her goal moving forward is to be well-structured so that she can generate better earnings and jobs for her children. Her greatest challenge is not having sufficient operating capital to expand her business by purchasing tools and equipment since these items are becoming more sophisticated all the time.

In order to resolve this problem, Cleofelina is applying for a Kiva loan, her first form of financing through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will use the money to buy a sewing machine that will improve her production process and result in better-quality work, especially with dresses and uniforms. This will make an impact on her market of existing customers and will help her to acquire new ones. Her potential for success will rise as she gains more knowledge of the market, refines her technique, and improves her production times. Higher quality in her finished products represents more money.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Zuhro

texts.ru: Зухро  26 лет, разведена, имеет 5 дочерей. Она мать одиночка, добросовестная, умная, ответственная и очень трудолюбивая. Занимается шитьем национальных платьев. Она работает в ателье. Зухро имеет очень много постоянных клиентов. Её занятие является основным источником дохода. Кроме заказов она шьет платья для продажи. На полученный кредит хочет расширить свой бизнес, закупить сезонную ткань. Готовые платья она сдает знакомым для реализации. Зухро надеется на вашу помощь и поддержку, так как ей нужно воспитывать детей, дать им образование.
texts.en: Zuhro is 26 years old, divorced and has five daughters.  She is a single mother, conscientious, smart, responsible and very hardworking.  She is involved in sewing national dresses.  She works in an atelie.  Zuhro has a lot of regular customers.  Her business is the primary source of income.  Besides orders, she sells dresses for sale.  She wants to use this loan to expand her business and buy seasonal fabrics.  She gives made dresses to her friends to sell.  Zuhro relies on your help and support because she needs to raise her children and provide them with education.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fabrics

loans.name: Asad

texts.ru: Асад женат и на воспитании имеет пятерых детей. У него семья очень дружная и трудолюбивая. Более 15 лет он занимается выращиванием картошки и пшеницы. Кроме выращивания сельхозкультур он занимается купле- продажей скота. Асад хочет расширить свой бизнес и получить хорошую прибыль, чтобы купить землю и построить дом. Асад хотел бы получить займ для покупки минеральных удобрений для обработки земли. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Asad is married and raising five children.  His family is very friendly and hardworking.  He has been involved in growing potatoes and wheat for over 15 years.  Besides growing agricultural crops, he is involved in buying and selling livestock.  Asad wants to expand his business and make a good profit in order to buy land and build a house.  Asad wants to obtain this loan to buy mineral fertilizers for treating the soil.  He relies on your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and treat the soil

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica tiene 22 años, vive en compañía de Ravelo, su esposo desde hace 8 años. Tienen dos hijos: Jeyson y Zahorí. Viven en la casa de sus suegros ubicada en la localidad de Batanyacu.

Desde las primeras horas del día trabaja junto a su esposo en la fabricación de zapatos de diversos tamaños y estilos, los cuales vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Ahí obtiene muchas ganancias, con lo que pueden sustentar los gastos domésticos y los estudios de sus hijos. Además de ello, Jessica vende productos de belleza por catálogo a los pobladores de su localidad, ya cuenta con clientes fijos. Adicionalmente, incursionó en la venta de zapatillas juveniles, también por catálogo, por lo que espera obtener muchos ingresos. Su meta es viajar a diversas ciudades para incrementar sus ventas y así poder comenzar con su propio negocio.

Ella pertenece al grupo “Las mujeres del éxito” y éste es el primer préstamo con MFP. Agradece el apoyo que le brindan, ya que adquiere el capital de trabajo que necesita para poder trabajar y progresar en su negocio. Además, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que los integrantes de su asociación son personas solidarias y responsables.
Jessica invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de zapatillas y productos de belleza para su venta.
texts.en:
Jessica is 22, and lives with Ravelo, her husband of eight years. They have two children: Jeyson and Zahorí. They live in their in-law's house located in the town of Batanyacu.

From the early hours of the day she works with her husband making shoes of various sizes and styles, which she sells in the city's wholesale market. 

From this she gets a lot of earnings, with which they can pay for their household expenses and their children's schooling.  In addition to this, Jessica sells beauty products by catalog to local people, and already has an established clientele. 

Additionally, she has started selling children's shoes, also by catalog, and hopes to get a great deal of income from this. Her goal is to travel to various cities to increase her sales, and this way be able to start her own business.

She belongs to the “Las Mujeres del Éxito” (Successful Women) group, and this is the first loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support she has been offered, as she is acquiring the working capital she needs to be able to work and progress in her business. Furthermore, she promises to make her installment payments on time, as the members of her group are supportive and responsible individuals. 

Jessica will invest the money she has applied for in the purchase of sport shoes and beauty products for her retail business.

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Warakas 8 Gaspul Group

texts.en: This is the reloan for Warakas 8 Gaspul group. With her previous loan, she (Nani) could sell more rice and side dishes and have savings to pay for her child's school fees. Now she plans to use her part of the loan to buy more ingredients for side dishes such as fish and eggs to sell. She hopes she can stand up to her customers and expand her business. Someday she hopes she can open a small restaurant.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for side dishes such as fish and eggs to sell

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en:
Adwowa produces charcoal for sale at Abura near Cape Coast. She has done this for two years now. Adwowa is married and has seven dependents. She uses her income to support her husband to feed their children and pay their school fees.  

Adwowa will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce the charcoal to sell. With the new profit from her expanded business, Adwowa will produce the charcoal in large quantity.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to produce the charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena lives with her four children and husband, a labourer, at the University of Cape Coast. For two years now, Abena has been producing charcoal for sale at Edukrom, located near Cape Coast, using her income to help support her husband in feeding their children and paying their school fees.

Abena will use her loan to purchase firewood to produce more charcoal to sell. With the new profits arising from her expanded business, she will produce the charcoal in larger quantities.

loans.use: to purchase firewood to produce charcoal  to  sell.

loans.name: Esperance

texts.en:
Esperance is 45 years old and is married with five children between 3 and 18 years old. She sells various goods such as water, cooking oil, beans, sugar, biscuits,., etc and she has been in this business for one year. Her business is open from 6 a.m to 7 p.m every day except on Sunday and she currently employs one person to help her. 

Esperance has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase various goods such as water, cooking oil, beans, sugar, biscuits, etc., to sell. With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and she will be able to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as water, cooking oil, beans, sugar, biscuits. etc., to sell.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
This is Teresita, 54, a resident of Caloocan City, Philippines. She is married to Serafin, who is an overseas Filipino worker. She has two children. One is in college and the other is already working. She is thankful to God that she was able to send her children to college. She is now hoping that her child in school will be able to finish college and find a good job.

Teresita is operating a variety store where she sells basic commodities including ice. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, five pesos of cooking oil, or an egg. Teresita earns money by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Her variety store provides easier access to basic commodities for her friends and neighbors to have in their homes. She earns around PHP 500 a day.

In order to continue the operations of her variety store, she is requesting PHP 8,000. She will be
utilizing this loan to buy groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Teresita wishes to expand her business so that she may able to help her child who is in college with expenses. She is faithful in meeting with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship
group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of
God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Mweni

texts.en:
Mweni is a mother of three children between the ages of 15 and 25 years, two of whom attend school. She has been operating a fruit-selling business for three years now and aspires to expand the business and hire employees. Mweni lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. High transportation costs and the children's school fees are her major challenges.

Having joined Yehu to access funds to boost her business, Mweni is now requesting a loan of Ksh 10000 to help her acquire an additional stock of fruits to sell.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for more fruits such as apples, oranges and bananas to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet is married with four children and all her children go to school. She doesn’t take care of additional family. She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for seven months. She has applied for a loan of 600,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDST SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Besides this charcoal business, she generates additional income from rental houses. She sells to all categories of people both on wholesale and retail and works seven days a week. Her major business challenges include transportation of bags of charcoal from villages to the market and selling during rainy season which hinders her movements. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can buy a delivery van to ease in transportation and also to educate her children up to university. She resides in a rented house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a single lady who has been operating a canteen for the last seven years selling retail to high school students and teachers. In addition, she sells clothes along the streets to the local residents in a trading center. Caroline dreams of opening a shop in the future and hiring employees. She has rented a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes her greatest monthly expense as rent. She says she joined Yehu to get funds to expand her business.
With the loan of KES 20,000, she will be able to add stock to her canteen.

loans.use: to add stock to her canteen.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is 31 years old and from Gaza. He is a married man with two daughters.
He has been working in a food stall for 5 years. He has one employee. He makes “falafel.” Falafel is a traditional food in Palestine.
Ahmad asked Ryada for funds to buy a glass casing for the stall and an umbrella in order to add healthy protection to the cooking process.
His future ambition is to improve the quality of life of his family and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy glass casing and an umbrella for his food stall.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for flour, eggs, sugar and other ingredients to make cookies

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en:
Felicia, married to a man who works with a press, has been selling secondhand ladies' and children's dresses for four years now. She uses her income to support her husband in paying their utility and accomodation bills.

Felicia is requesting this loan to purchase more secondhand dresses to sell, and with the new profits plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more secondhand ladies' and children's dresses to sell.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en: Caroline is a 53-year-old married woman with five children between the ages of 22 and 31 and none of them is attending school. She operates a café, which has been running for the past year and she dreams of opening a clothing shop in the future. Caroline lives in her own house and has neither electricity nor piped water. She describes the high cost of commodities to be her major challenge and that her primary customers include passersby, local residents and travelers. She spends more on food for the family over the month. The loan will help her to purchase bales of wheat flour and sacks of beans.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and beans.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch is 49 years old and she lives in a rural village in the Dambae district, Cambodia. She has three children, one of whom is still in school. She and her husband earn a living by planting cassava on three hectares of farmland and selling Khmer noodles in the village. In addition, she supplements her income by working for others for pay. She has been in the Khmer noodle business for 10 years and the cassava business for 2 years. 

Touch's group comprises two female members who live in the same village and they both have been with VisionFund for two loan cycles already. Touch manages to earn her daily income of around 22,000 Cambodia Riels (KHR) per day to support the family's expenses. Now leading her group to apply for another loan with Kiva's partner VisionFund, Touch, who is the leader, wants to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her income and improve her living standards.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farmland.

loans.name: Kamach's Group

texts.en:
Kamach is a 43-year-old widow. She lives with her three children in a rural area located in the Mongkol Borey district, Cambodia. Rice farming has been her main source of the family's income for several years. She supplements her income by selling vegetables to better support her family. With her current business, she can make a daily income of 22,000 KHR, but can save only around 8,000 each day. 

This is the first loan for Kamach's group, consisting of two female members who live in the same village. As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund of 1,000,000 KHR each. She will use her portion to buy fertilizer and some vegetables for her business. 

She hopes to make more income so as to build on some savings to fulfill her goal of having a rice farm up to one hectare.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and some vegetables for her business.

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: A And J Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “A and J” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Makeni, a city in northern Sierra Leone. They have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to seek for a loan of 1,200,000 Sierra Leonean Leones (SLL) in order to further expand their business. 

The leader of this group is Jariatu who is pictured on the right. Jariatu is age 36; she was born in Makeni city where she is currently residing together with her husband and four children. Her husband is a businessman too and her children are attending primary and secondary schools. For many years now, Jariatu has been a businesswoman. She owns a general store. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy sugar, mints, slippers, etc., in a large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, mints, slippers, etc., in a large quantity to add to her business

loans.name: Melania

texts.es:
Melania tiene 57 años, vive con su esposo Héctor, en su casa propia. Tienen 7 hijos, pero que ya no viven con ellos. 
Ella se dedica al cultivo de papas, arvejas, zanahorias y habas, las cuales vende en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad. Gracias a esta actividad y a su esfuerzo ha logrado criar y educar a sus 7 hijos, quienes ya dejaron el hogar para ser independientes, y está orgullosa de ellos. “Llevo más de 30 años en esta actividad y en todo este tiempo he aprendido a mejorar mi producción”, comenta. A pesar de su edad ella continúa cogiendo las herramientas y trabajando la tierra con el mismo esfuerzo de antes, pues sus metas son claras. También se dedica a la crianza de animales como vacas y toros, los que engorda y después de 4, 5 y hasta 6 meses negocia a buenos precios. Para estas dos actividades recibe el apoyo de su esposo, quien nunca la deja sola. Son una pareja ejemplar.

Éste sería su crédito número 6 con MFP, por eso se compromete en ser puntual en el pago de las cuotas mensuales. Además, le gusta el trabajo dentro de su banco comunal “Virgen María”, donde todos los socios son personas responsables y solidarias.
Con el dinero solicitado comprará dos latas de semillas de espinacas para otra siembra que iniciará apenas reciba el préstamo.
texts.en:
Melania is 57 years old and lives in her own home with husband Héctor. They have seven children, but they no longer live with them.

Melania grows potatoes, peas, carrots, and beans, and then sells them at the wholesale market in the city. Thanks to this business and her efforts, she has been able to raise her seven children and provide them with an education. Now that they have left home and are independent, she is very proud of them. "I have been farming for more than 30 years and I am learning ways to improve my production all the time," Melania says. Despite her age, she continues to carry her tools and work the land with the same amount of effort as before, except now her goals are clearer. Melania also raises animals, such as cows and bulls, for fattening. She keeps them between 4-6 months before selling them at good prices. Her husband helps her with these two business activities, so she is never alone. He is an exemplary partner.

This will be her sixth loan with MFP. Melania promises to be punctual with her monthly payments. She also enjoys working with her Communal Bank, “Virgen María” (Virgin Mary), because all of the members and responsible and supportive people. The money she requested will be used to buy two cans of spinach seeds that she will begin planting once she receives the loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret  is married with four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of additional family members (old parents). She has a business of selling charcoal and has been in this business for five years. She has applied for a loan of  500,000 Ugandan shillings (UGX) from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. Along with this charcoal business, she also generates additional income through rental rooms. She sells to all categories of people on retail and works six days a week. She is aspiring to see her business grow so big that she owns a delivery van to ease transportation and also to become a wholesaler. She resides in a rented two-room house, and the family has access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses include school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Andranik

texts.en:
41-year-old Andranik runs his own small barber shop in Vanadzor. Andranik has many regular costumers because he has broad experience, as he has been engaged in this business more than 15 years. Andranik has equipped his barber's shop without assistance, and thanks to his occupation he keeps his family.  

This is Andranik's second loan from Nor Horizon and now he is asking for a AMD 300,000 loan to buy a new barber's chair and also a water heater for his business. New facilities will allow Andranik to serve his clients in comfortable conditions and to meet their requirements. 

Andranik is married and he has three small children. Andranik’s wife stays at home and takes care of the children.

loans.use: to buy a new barber's chair and also a water heater for his business

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es: La señora Maria Isabel es una mujer humilde, esforzada y trabajadora, continua con su negocio de tortillas y venta de comida productos que son vendidos en su casa de habitacion desde muy temprano. Asegura que ademas de la ayuda economica que le ha brindado la micro-financiera para mantener una solidez buena en su negocio y ver mejoras a su hogar, su esposo quien es jardinero tambien le ayuda con las obligaciones del hogar y en ocasiones a vender la comida que ella misma realiza. En esta ocasión el credito lo necesita para la realizacion de un cuarto el cual conllevara la compra de los siguientes materiales: Hierro, bloques, alambre de amarre, arena, tablas, piedrin, cemento, clavos entre otros. Expresa sentirse muy contenta por el hecho de dia a dia ir mejorando su humilde vivienda y con esto poderles ofrecer mejores condiciones de vida a los suyos. Sus proyectos a un futuro seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Sra. Maria is a humble, determined, and hardworking woman who continues in her business of producing and selling tortillas and other food products from her home. Her work begins very early. She says that the financial support provided through the micro-loans have enabled her to maintain a solid business and to make improvements to her home. Her husband works as a gardener and helps with the household obligations. Occasionally he will sell the food that she prepares.

On this occasion, the loan is needed to complete the construction of a room. The money will be used to buy the following materials: iron, blocks, wire, sand, planks, gravel, cement, nails, and other supplies. Maria says she is very happy that she is able every day to make improvements to her modest home, which will result in better living conditions for her loved ones. Her future goals include continuing with the improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for building a room.

loans.name: Elene

texts.en:
Elene is sixty years old. She lives with her thirty-five-year-old son Ilia who is private worker in his village. The family earns money through an agricultural business. Elene has a milking cow and a calf. She produces cheese, milk and curds and sells them on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. They work hard but still live in poverty. 

Elene has requested a loan to repair her house. The existing house is very old and damaged, the furniture is old and uncomfortable too. With this loan Elene will be able to change the furniture and repair the house. Due to the above mentioned, the  living conditions of the family will be improved and they will be able to spend their evenings after a hard working day in a more comfortable environment.

Elene hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to repair her house and buy new furniture.

loans.name: Salim

texts.en:
Salim is a single man who has been operating a shop for the past one and a half years, selling his goods to the general public. He describes market competition and high price of goods as his major challenges. Salim lives in a family house that has neither electricity nor piped water. He supports his parents by providing food for the family which also adds his monthly expenses. Apart from operating the shop, he is also employed and gets some salary which he invests in his business, though not enough to expand it. This made him join Yehu: to get access to loans to boost his business.

With the loan of KES 25,000, he intends to add a stock of maize flour, cooking fat, detergents and bales of wheat flour to his shop.

loans.use: to add a stock of maize flour, cooking fat, detergents and bales of wheat flour to his shop.

loans.name: Fatina

texts.en:
Fatina is a single mother of three children and all her children go to school. She also takes care of additional family members (her sister and her children). She has a business selling charcoal and has been in this business for ten years. 

She has applied for a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more bags of charcoal. She works seven days a week and works from her home. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activities. Her major business challenges includes seasonality and thieves. She aspires to seeing her business grow big so that she can start selling wholesale only and also start going to villages for charcoal. 

She resides in a rented house and the family has no access to piped water and electricity. Her monthly expenses includes school fees and rent.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Beka

texts.en:
Beka is thirty-four years old. He lives in a small village, in the district of Telavi with his family; his parents, brother and sister-in-law. The family runs an agricultural business, in particular dealing with livestock. Beka has his own car and along with the agriculture he is busy with transportation. He provides a goods transportation services to the local population and gets service fees. The total average monthly income of the family is 1,200 Lari.

Beka requested a loan to purchase calves. He wants to raise them and sell then locally after several months. Grown calves will be sold with a price mark-up. The family will get additional income. With the increased income he will be able to expand his agricultural business; he plans to purchase calves and to make a good and big cattle-shed. Due to the above mentioned, the living conditions of the family will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Agartha

texts.en: Agartha is a food vendor. She cooks banku for sale and she serves it with okro and fish stew. She has done this for 5 years. She lives together with her husband at Edukrom near Cape Coast. She is married and has 5 children. Her husband is a trader. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying for their children’s school fees. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize to prepare her banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to create a place for her customers to eat.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize to prepare her banku for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary sells cloth in Edukrom, near Cape Coast. She is married and has two children. Her husband is a electrician. She uses her income to assist her husband to pay their utility bills.

Mary will use her loan to purchase different kinds of cloth to sell. With the new profit she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase different kinds of cloth to sell.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
Victoria tiene 42 años, vive en compañía de Eusebio, su esposo desde hace 22 años. Tienen tres hijos a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Santa María.
Como buena madre de familia trabaja sin descanso para el futuro de sus hijos. Desde las primeras horas del día comienza a cuidar sus sembríos de alverja, maíz y cebada en los terrenos agrícolas que alquila, pues todavía no cuenta con unos propios. También posee 4 vacas y 3 cerdos. De las vacas, vende la leche que producen, un promedio de 15 a 20 litros por día, los cuales son recogidos por los lecheros (así les llaman a los trabajadores que recogen la leche para la fábrica de lácteos). Ahora ella desea incrementar la cantidad de vacas que posee, pues espera aumentar la producción de leche.

Éste es el sexto crédito que tiene con MFP, donde obtuvo el apoyo que tanto necesitaba. Además, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que su asociación lo integran personas responsables con ella.
Victoria invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de suficiente pasto para alimentar a su ganado el resto del año.
texts.en:
Victoria is 42, and lives with Eusebio, her husband of 22 years. They have three children, whom they look after in their own house located in the town of Santa María.  

As a good parent, she works tirelessly for her children's future. From the early hours of the day, she begins looking after her crops of peas, corn and barley on the farmland she rents, as she still does not have her own. She also owns four cows and three pigs. She sells the milk that the cows produce, an average of 15 to 20 liters a day, which is collected by the milkmen (this is what they call the workers who collect the milk for the dairy products plant). Now she wishes to increase the number of cows she owns, as she hopes to increase her milk production.

This is her sixth loan with MFP, where she obtained the support she so much needed. In addition, she promises to make her installment payments on time, as her group is made up of individuals as responsible as she is. Victoria will invest the money applied for in the purchase of sufficient grass to feed her cattle for the rest of the year.

loans.use: To buy feed for her cattle.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta tiene 58 años, vive en la localidad de Ahuaycha, junto a su esposo Pedro, y el menor de sus hijos, al que cuida con mucho esmero.
Su vivienda se ubica en una de las zonas más altas de la localidad, por ello todas las mañanas se dedica a pastar su ganado vacuno, pues ahí existe mucho pasto natural. La leche que producen sus vacas la vende en su misma casa, a donde los trabajadores de la fábrica de productos lácteos la visitan constantemente. 
Adicionalmente, junto a su esposo, siembran papa y maíz en grandes cantidades, siendo éste su principal ingreso económico. Su cosecha la comercializa en la ciudad donde obtiene mejores ingresos.

Ella pertenece al grupo “Ichicruz” y éste es su tercer préstamo con MFP. Agradece el apoyo que le brindan, ya que adquiere el capital de trabajo que necesita para poder trabajar y progresar en su negocio. Además, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que los integrantes de su asociación son personas solidarias y responsables.
Modesta invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de fertilizantes naturales para su próxima siembra.
texts.en:
Modesta is 58, and lives in the town of Ahuaycha with her husband Pedro and her youngest child, whom she does her very best to take care of. 

Her house is located in one of the highest areas in the settlement, so every morning she pastures her cattle,  since there is a great deal of natural grazing. She sells the milk the cows produce from her own home, where the workers from the dairy products plant visit her constantly. 

Additionally, she and her husband plant potatoes and corn in large quantities, this being her main source of income. She sells her harvest in the city, where she obtains better earnings.  

She belongs to the “Ichicruz” group, and this is her third loan with MFP. She is grateful for the support she has been offered, as she is acquiring the working capital she needs to be able to work and progress in her business. Furthermore, she promises to make her installment payments on time, as the members of her group are supportive and responsible individuals. 

Modesta will invest the money applied for in the purchase of natural fertilizers for her next planting.

loans.use: To buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El Sr. Adolfo es casado, tiene 3 hijos y vive en su casa propia en la ciudad de Encarnación. El se dedica a la herrería y cuenta que tiene su propio taller en su casa hace más de 10 años.
Comenta que gracias a su esfuerzo y sumado a la ayuda de su familia ha podido ir creciendo y de esa forma poder ayudarles para el día a día. El sueño de Adolfo es que sus hijos terminen una carrera universitaria y sean personas de bien, que no tengan que pasar por ningún tipo de necesidades.
El solicita el crédito para la compra de hierros en cantidad, con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes y seguir trabajando. Agradece por la ayuda de que está recibiendo por parte de fundación paraguaya y de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sr. Adolfo is married and has three children. He lives in his own home in the city of Encarnación. He is a blacksmith and has operated a workshop out of his home for more than 10 years. Adolfo says that thanks to his efforts and all of the support from his family, he has been able to grow so that he can help them each day. He dreams of seeing his children receive their university degrees and become good people. They are not deprived of any of their needs.

The loan he is requesting will be used to purchase iron in bulk quantities so that he can satisfy the demands of his customers and continue working. He is grateful for the help he has received from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy iron.

loans.name: Lévitique Plus Group

texts.en:
Angel, aged 57, is the chairwoman of the Community Bank named “Lévitique Plus.” It is composed of 17 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Angel, married, has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1996. She sells beverages. Her business is located to the southwest of Kinshasa. Angel has already MFI HOPE DRC loans ten times and repaid them correctly. The loan she will obtain next will be used to buy more crates of drinks to resell at retail with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of US $100 per week. Angel’s ambition is to become a beverage provider in her area. She is a mother of nine children between 14 and 31 years old. Four of them attend school.

loans.use: to increase the inventory of her business by buying crates of beverages to resell at a profit.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en: Mariam is a mother of three boys who are attending school. She is married to Abdalla, a driver, and they live in a rental house that has both electricity and piped water. Mariam operates a green grocery where she sells her goods at the market. She aspires to open a cereal shop in the future. Seasonality is the major challenge facing her business. She joined Yehu to get loans to boost her business. Her primary customers are the general public. She plans to purchase fruits and vegetables using the requested loan of KSH 20,000.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a father of two girls and a boy. He has enrolled all his children in school and they are progressing well with their studies. For the past five years, he has been operating a grocery business selling at the market centre to the market residents. He dreams of opening a shop in the future. Bakari owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food for the family and school fees. He experiences a challenge of seasonality, especially during the dry season. 
 
With the loan of KSH 40,000, he intends to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.use: to purchase fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en:
Adjoa cooks and sells kenkey banku (fermented corn dough wrapped in corn or banana leaves). She serves it with fried fish, pepper, and tomato sauce in Edukrom, near Cape Coast. She is married and has three children.

Adjoa has had this business for three years. She uses her income to support her husband to feed their family and pay their accommodation bills. Her loan will be used to purchase bags of maize and fish to preparing her kenkey for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to mount a better stall for the sale of her kenkey and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish, which she uses in preparing kenkey for sale.

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 20 años, está casada con Edgar desde hace un año. Aún no tienen hijos, pero esperan con mucha ilusión tener uno, cuando sea el momento. 
Edgar empezó a trabajar en la capital (Lima) en una fábrica de pantalones, es por eso que Marisol también pasa mucho tiempo allá donde trabaja vendiendo ropa. 
Pero el deseo de los dos es establecerse en su pueblo, donde tienen muchos planes para progresar y estar con los suyos.
