Con los 1,500 nuevos soles que solicita comprará sacos de abono para esparcir en su parcela.
texts.en:
Julia is a very hardworking woman.  She’s 36-years-old and lives in her own house with her husband, Fortunato, 38, and their three beloved children.

Her work starts very early in her field where she tills the soil to cultivate cocoa bean plants.  She knows that most of her neighbors work in agriculture but she strives to have better harvests than her neighbors.  

She likes her work because with help from her husband they’ve been harvesting good fruit for 12 years.  What is a bit difficult is having to transport the harvested sacks all the way to the city to sell the beans.  In time, she wants to buy a motorized cargo cart in order to transport her crops more easily but for the moment she wants to weed her plants.

This is her second MFP loan and she’s thankful for the trust placed in her because she’ll be able to continue working at what she likes to do best of all.  
She is a committed, esteemed member of her communal bank because of her punctuality.

She will use the 1500 new soles requested to buy sacks of manure to spread in her field.

loans.use: to buy manure.

loans.name: Obdulia

texts.es:
Obdulia tiene 43 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Agripino, de 53 años, y sus seis hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. 
Ella es una mujer con visión a futuro, siempre quiso formar parte de una asociación acopiadora, labor que actualmente realiza. Lleva 5 años en esta actividad de compra y venta de cacao y café. Los agricultores que llevan su cosecha donde Obdulia son muy bien pagados, pero no sólo labora en su localidad, sino que también viaja a diferentes zonas para abastecerse de sacos de cacao y café. Lo recolectado lo lleva a comercializarlo a las ciudades donde compran en mayor cantidad. 

Éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP y se siente contenta por contar con su apoyo, también agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por ser personas responsables.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita comprará 30 sacos de cacao para poder llevarlas a comercializar a la ciudad.
texts.en:
Obdulia, 43, lives in her own house with her husband, Agripino, 53, and their six children that she wants to provide a better quality of life for.

She is a forward-looking person.  She always wanted to be part of a crop gathering association and this is the work she currently does.  She’s been in this activity of buying and selling cocoa beans and coffee for five years.  Farmers that take their crops to Obdulia are paid very well.  But she doesn’t just work in her location but also travels to various zones to stock up on sacks of cocoa beans and coffee.  What she collects she takes to sell in cities where it’s purchased in larger amounts.

This is her MFP loan #6 and she feels happy to have its support; she also thanks the members of her communal bank for being responsible people.

She will use the requested 1000 new soles to buy 30 sacks of cocoa beans to go sell them in the city.

loans.use: to buy sacks of cocoa beans.

loans.name: Guzmán

texts.es:
Guzmán es un hombre muy alegre y laborioso, tiene 45 años y vive en su propia casa junto a su esposa Justiniana, de 45 años, y sus cuatro hijos. 
Hace 25 años que le enseñaron a laborar en la chacra, desde entonces se dedica a labrar la tierra para producir cacao y café. Estos productos son los más rentables en su zona, es por eso que los eligió. Normalmente trabaja solo, pero en los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y de jornaleros a quienes les paga por su labor. Luego de varios años de realizar esta actividad ya es una costumbre, por lo que no tiene muchas dificultades, pues sabe cómo obtener buenos frutos. Por ello, siempre está constante abonando y manteniendo limpia su parcela. 

Éste es su cuarto crédito con MFP y agradece por la confianza que le brindan, pues se siente muy contento porque seguirá con sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo, agradece a su banco comunal por ser socios serios y solidarios.
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que solicita comprará fertilizantes y abono orgánico para sus plantas.
texts.en:
Guzmán is a cheerful and hardworking man. He is 45 and lives in his own house along with his wife Justiniana, who is 45 years old, and their four children. 

He was taught to work on the farm twenty-five years ago and since then he has made a living working the land to cultivate cacao and coffee. These products are the most profitable in his area, which is why he chose them. Normally, he works alone, but during the harvest time he gets help from his sons and day laborers who he pays for their work. After many years of carrying out this work it has become a custom for him, which is why he does not encounter many difficulties. He know how to produce good result. This is why his is constantly fertilizing his plot of land and keeping it clean.

This is his fourth loan with MFP and he is grateful for the trust he has been offered. He is very happy because he will be able to continue with this work plans. He is also grateful to his communal bank for being serious and united partners. He will buy fertilizers and organic manure for his plants with the 1,000 nuevos soles he is requesting.

loans.use: to buy manure and natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.es:
Zenaida tiene 32 años, está casada con Robinsón, de 35 años. Tienen tres hijos, y la casa donde viven es propia y está hecha de material noble.
Desde hace 10 años siembra cacao y café, actividad que realiza junto a su esposo, pero en los tiempos de limpieza y cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de peones. Lo que más le gusta de esta actividad es ver los frutos muy grandes y sus plantas productivas; sin embargo, lo difícil es no poder eliminar fácilmente las plagas que interrumpen el desarrollo de sus cultivos.
La producción que obtienen es de muy buena calidad, por lo que le es rentable al momento de venderla en las sociedades acopiadoras. Para más adelante, desea ampliar su parcela cultivando más plantas de cacao. 

Éste es su crédito número 6 con MFP y se siente agradecida por el apoyo que le brindan, ya que así puede continuar con sus planes de trabajo. Asimismo, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. También le gusta ser parte de su banco comunal porque trabaja con personas responsables y fraternas. 
Con los 500 nuevos soles que solicita comprará más plantas de cacao para cultivar en su parcela.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 32, is married to Robinson, 35, and they have three children; the house they live in is theirs and it’s made of substantial materials.

She’s been growing cocoa beans and coffee for ten years, an activity she does alongside her husband but during harvest and weeding seasons she gets help from day laborers.  What she likes best about this activity is to see the fruit be very large and her plants to be productive.  However, what’s difficult is not being able to easily eliminate the infestations that interrupt her crops’ development.

The harvests she obtains are of very good quality which makes them profitable at the moment they are sold to gathering societies.  For later on she’d like to expand her field and cultivate more cocoa bean plants.

This is her MFP loan #6 and she feels grateful for the support being given because she’ll be able to continue with her business plans.  She also commits to be very punctual with her installment payments.  She also likes being part of her communal bank because she works with fraternal and responsible people.

She will use the requested 500 new soles to buy more cocoa bean plants to grow on her parcel.

loans.use: to buy cocoa bean plants.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 53 years old. He lives with his wife, two children (18 and 23 years old), and daughter-in-law. His 18-year-old daughter has chronic health problems and gets a relevant pension from the local government. David and his son are involved in a business together. They work hard, but the family is big and their income is not enough to cover living expenses. They still live in poverty. David has a car and every morning he goes to the woods, prepares firewood, loads it in his car, and then delivers it to the village and sells it on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Georgia Laris (GEL).

David requested a loan to start a new business. He will purchase seasonal agricultural products for resale and sell the products in nearby towns using his own car. The new business venture will increase the income of the family. With this increased income, he will be able to expand his new business. Due to the above mentioned, the family's living conditions will be improved.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural products for resale.

loans.name: Frida

texts.es:
Frida tiene 35 años, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo, Fólder, de 35 años, y sus cuatro estimados hijos. 
Desde hace 20 años se dedica a la agricultura, por lo que siempre está en su parcela supervisando el crecimiento de sus plantas de cacao. Para el tiempo de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros, quienes le ayudan a extraer de forma rápida su producto, que luego lleva a las sociedades acopiadoras de su localidad, quienes le gratifican muy bien por sus granos de cacao. 

Éste es su tercer crédito con MFP y asegura que seguirá cumpliendo con sus cuotas de pago. Además, se siente contento por laborar con socios responsables en su banco comunal.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que solicita podrá quitar la hierba de sus terrenos y también comprará abono.
texts.en:
Frida, 35, lives in her own house with her husband, Fólder, 35, and their four beloved children.  For 20 years she has worked in agriculture, so she is always at her plot of land supervising the growth of her cacao plants.  For the harvest she has the help of day laborers who help her extract the product quickly.  Later she takes the crop to the distribution societies, where they compensate her very well for her cacao beans.

This is her third loan with MFP and she guarantees that she will continue to make her payments on time.  In addition, she is happy about working with responsible members in her communal bank.

With the 2,000 nuevos soles [PEN] that she is requesting she will be able to weed her land and also buy fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Otilia

texts.es:
Otilia tiene 42 años, es padre y madre para sus cinco hijos, a quienes brinda una buena educación. Juntos viven en su casa propia hecha a base de madera. 
Ella se dedica a cultivar plantas de cacao y raíces de barbasco. Esta labor la realiza hace 20 años y comenta que en los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de jornaleros. Después de la cosecha vende su producción a los centros de acopio, donde genera muy buenas ganancias. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ser independiente, y lo que le resulta difícil es tener que combatir con las plagas que aquejan sus cultivos. 

Éste es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se siente orgullosa por la confianza que le brindan para desarrollar su labor. De igual forma, agradece a su banco comunal por laborar con socios responsables.
Con el préstamo solicitado contratará a jornaleros para que le apoyen en eliminar las malezas de su cultivo. Con el resto abonará su parcela.
texts.en:
Otilia, 42, is father and mother to her five children who she’s providing with a good education.  They all live together in her own house made of wood.

She grows cocoa bean plants and barbasco [an evergreen shrub] roots.  She’s been in this occupation for 20 years and she comments that she gets help from day laborers during harvesting.  After harvesting, she sells her production to gathering centers where she earns good profits.  What she likes best about her work is being able to be independent and what’s difficult about it is having to combat infestations that afflict her crops.

This is her 4th MFP loan and she feels proud of the trust being placed in her to develop her work.  Similarly, she thanks her communal bank for working with responsible members.

She will use the requested loan to hire day laborers to help her remove weeds from her crops and the rest to apply manure to her parcel.

loans.use: to hire day laborers to clear her parcel.

loans.name: Sofía

texts.es:
Sofía es una mujer divorciada, tiene 59 años y junto a sus hijos; Carmen de 22 años y Miriam de 19 años, viven en su casa propia.
Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes (leche evaporada, arroz, azúcar, verduras, bebidas, entre otros). Esta labor la lleva realizando desde hace 10 años, y normalmente lo hace sola, pero sus hijas la apoyan cuando tiene que salir a la ciudad a comprar mercadería. Su actividad es muy rentable porque tiene ganancias suficientes para ayudar con los gastos de estudio para sus hijas, como también para comprar lo necesario en casa. Con el tiempo, desea ampliar su casa para agrandar el local de su negocio.

Éste es su crédito número 5 con MFP, una vez más, se compromete a ser puntual con sus cuotas de pago. Asimismo, agradece a los socios de su banco comunal por la confianza que le brindan.
Con los 2,000 nuevos soles que solicita se abastecerá de mercadería para implementar su negocio.
texts.en:
Sofia is 59 years old, divorced,and she lives in her own house together with her children; Carmen who is 22 years old and Miriam 19 years old.

She makes a living selling groceries (evaporated milk, rice, sugar, vegetables, beverages and others).  She has been doing this work for 10 years and normally she works alone.  Her daughters help her, however,  when she needs to go to the city to get merchandise.  Her business is very profitable as she has enough income to help with the educational expenses of her daughters and also to purchase the necessities of her home.  In time she would like to enlarge her house to be able to have a larger space for her business.

This is loan number 5 with MFP and once again she promises to be punctual with her payments.  Additionally she thanks the members of her community bank for their confidence in her.

With the 2000 new soles that she is requesting she will supply her business with more merchandise.

loans.use: to increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Blendi

texts.en:
Blendi is 34 years old and married with three children, 8 and 5 years old and one month old. It is his first time requesting a loan to add four more beehives to his existing ones. This time of year, he says, “the price of hives is extremely expensive because bees have their own production season. Thus I cannot afford to buy them without getting a loan.” 

For the past ten years that he has been in the business of selling organic honey, Blendi has also been going to Greece during summertime for seasonal cherry picking work.  However, this year he decided to follow his passion and only do the bee farming since the demand for honey is very high in the country and on foreign markets as well; he was fortunate enough to be contacted by a couple of foreign buyers. 

Blendi wants to add four more hives to the current ones and also volunteer at maintaining an Eastern Orthodox Church nearby his house that was built in the thirteen century. He only hopes that his business will do well and that his dreams of being with his family throughout the year and selling more organic honey will be fulfilled.

loans.use: To purchase four beehives

loans.name: Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 44, vive junto a su esposo Delio, de 38 años, y sus dos queridos hijos Smith de 12 y Yordy de 10 años.
Ella es una mujer empeñosa y muy laboriosa, se dedica a labrar la tierra para cultivar cacao, café y plantas frutales. Esta labor la efectúa desde hace 13 años y es lo que mejor sabe hacer. En los tiempos de cosecha cuenta con el apoyo de peones, quienes le ayudan en todo lo necesario en su parcela. Posteriormente, lleva su producción a comercializar a los centro de acopio donde la gratifican muy bien por cada kilo. Lo que más le gusta de trabajo es obtener muy buenas cosechas después de tanto esfuerzo; sin embargo lo que le resulta difícil es tener que movilizar los sacos hasta las sociedades de venta. Por ello, para más adelante desea en comprar una motocarro; pero por ahora prioriza la limpieza de sus plantas de las hierbas.

Éste es su segundo crédito con MFP y una vez más, agradece por seguir colaborando con sus objetivos. También, está contenta con sus compañeros de su banco comunal porque son unidos y responsables. 
Con los 1,000 nuevos soles que ahora solicita comprará sacos de abono orgánico para fertilizar sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Vilma is 44 years old, and lives with her husband Delio (38 years old), and their two children, Smith (12 years old) and Yordy (10 years old). Vilma is a very hard-working, earnest woman who makes a living as a cacao, coffee, and fruit farmer. She began her work as a farmer 13 years ago, and she has much experience. During the harvest seasons, she hires additional laborers to harvest the crops on her land. After harvesting, she takes her crops to the collection center where she is paid per kilogram of produce. 

According to Vilma, the most rewarding part of her job is obtaining good harvests after lots of hard work. The most difficult part of her job, however, is transporting the heavy sacks of produce to the collection centers. With that challenge in mind, she hopes to eventually buy a car, but her priority right now is the cleanliness and health of her plants. 

This is her second loan with MFP, and she is grateful for the support she has received. She is happy with her partners at the community bank, as the group is a unified and responsible one. With the 1,000 nuevos soles in the loan, Vilma plans to purchase sacks of organic manure to fertilize her lands and crops.

loans.use: to purchase organic manure.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single mother of five children; only two of her children go to school. 

Mary has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for 12 years and sells to all categories of people on retail. She works seven days a week and works at the market. 

Mary's business challenges include thieves and the rainy season because she works at the market. She aspires to see her business grow big so that she can start going to villages for charcoal and also to build rental houses. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Vangjel

texts.en:
Vangjel and his family live in the countryside not far from the main city. He is a 32-year-old man and married with three daughters:  twelve, six and one year old. 

Vangjel has been in the livestock business for 10 years. His daily routine includes: taking the goats out early in morning to the mountains for grazing, staying with them all day and bringing them back late in the evening; milking them twice a day; selling lambs to the locals, making his delicious goat cheese that is very much in demand and going to the city on Saturdays to sell it. “I just love what I've been doing,” he said.

With the profit from this business, he built a basic house this past year. “Now at least the children have some more space to sleep, play and study,” he says.   Laughing he adds, “and you can be sure we don’t all sleep in the same room anymore.” Due to the fact that he invested the profit in building the house, he does not have enough saved to purchase some more goats at this point.  And this is the reason why Vangjel is requesting a loan for the first time. He is confident that he will pay off the loan, thanks to his responsible nature, he said.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Jovenes Katupyry Group

texts.es:
El Comité Jóvenes Katupyry trabaja con la fundación desde el año 2011. Actualmente el comité está integrado por 5 jóvenes de la misma zona, todos ellos amigos y conocidos de la zona. Los jóvenes del comité son muy unidos, responsables y solidarios, y cuentan que tienen muchas ganas de trabajar y salir adelante, tanto con el grupo e individualmente sin dejar de lado sus estudios.
Lourdes es una de las miembros del grupo, y ella cuenta que trabaja arduamente y de esa forma trata de salir adelante e invertir en sus estudios. Ella vende cosméticos sobre pedidos y es gracias a esto que tiene sus propios ingresos.
Ella solicita el crédito para poder invertirlo en cosméticos, para que de esa forma pueda seguir creciendo en su micro negocio. Ellos agradecen a la fundacion por la oportunidad que le dan a los jóvenes.
texts.en:
The Jóvenes Katupyry group has worked with the foundation since 2011. Currently the group is made up of five young people from the same area. All of them are friends and acquaintances from the area. The young people in the group are united, responsible, and supportive. They say that they have a great desire to work and get ahead, both as a group and individually, without giving up their studies. 

Lourdes is one of the members of the group. She says that she works hard and is trying to get ahead and invest in her studies. She sells cosmetics through orders and thanks to this she has her own income. She is requesting a loan to be able to invest in cosmetics so that she can continue to grow in her small business. 

They are grateful to the foundation for the opportunity given to them.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Elena

texts.ru:
Изначально Елена работала в колхозе,но из-за низкой оплаты труда,приняла решение открыть собственное частное предприятие и заниматься розничной торговлей овощами такими как баклажан, кукуруза и бахчевой культурой-арбуз.

Семья Елены это муж-инвалид и 24-х летний сын Вячеслав, который и помогает ей справляться с плантацией. Есть проблемы с поливом,т.к. очень тяжело полить 40 соток земли одновременно. Поэтому семья приняла решение купить оборудование для полива, которое повысит урожайность и облегчит труд людей.

В планах у Елены расширить свое хозяйство посадить клубнику и картофель, приобрести мотоблок для вспашки земли. В личных планах Елены лечение мужа инвалида.

Нуждается в вашем финансировании оборудования для полива.
texts.en: Elena originally worked at a collective farm, but due to a low salary, decided to open her own private business and get involved in retail sales of vegetables, such as eggplants, corn and melon crops - watermelons.  Elena's family is her disabled husband and 24 year-old son, Vyacheslav, who helps with the farming work.  She has problems with watering because it is very hard to water 40 sotkas of land at the same time.  This is why the family decided to purchase equipment for irrigation, which will increase the harvest-ability and ease human labor.  Elena's plans include expansion of her business, planting strawberries and potatoes and purchasing motorized equipment for plowing the soil.  Elena's personal plans include providing medical care for her disabled husband.  She needs your financial support to purchase irrigation equipment.

loans.use: to purchase an irrigation system

loans.name: Refik

texts.en:
Refik has been married for thirty years and he is fifty-one years old. His two older daughters are married and the youngest one is twenty years old and still living with her parents and helping in the family business of olive groves.  It is in the Albanian tradition that when children get married, parents give them part of what they own. This is exactly what Refik did: he gave his daughters two hundred olive trees, one hundred each. “There was not much left for me,” he says laughing.  This is the reason why Refik is looking for a loan and this would mark his first time borrowing, he says.

Refik has been in the olive grove business for twenty years and has been successful at it. He loves taking full care of the trees and enjoying the results. His clients are locals or from the cities that come to him only to buy olive and make olive pickles and organic olive oil for their only use. Kindly note here, that Albanians consume large quantities of olive pickles and oil, therefore, the demand is high. Some other clients are olive oil producers who buy olives to generate profit out of them. The profit is decent, Refik claims, if someone knows how to take care of olive groves and harvest them. “It’s hard work throughout the year, but I love it,” he says.

loans.use: To buy olive trees

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Tatu is a 55-year-old married woman. She has 5 children whose ages range from 20 to 35 years. She describes herself to be an honest woman. 

Tatu operates a retail stall where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a viable business location and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business. She will use the loan of 120,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to buy iron sheets for the completion of the retail store for selling water to the local residents.

Tatu has requested three previous loans, for which she managed to pay all the amount owed. Her business goal is to venture into the business of running a real estate housing provision within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the living standards of people by providing clean water to them.

loans.use: to buy iron sheets for completion of the business premise.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is the mother of one child, who is enrolled in school. She sells fish at the market to the public. Mwaka has been in this business for the past three years, and she aspires to open a food stall in the near future. She says that market competition is her major challenge, and that her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. Her other sources of income include earnings from her spouse. Mwaka lives in her own house, which has neither electricity nor running water. 
The loan of Ksh 20000 will help her to purchase stocks of fish and cooking oil.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Rosales

texts.es:
Rosales tiene 34 años, está casado con Jessica desde hace 8 años. Tienen dos hijos: Víctor y Jean Franco, a los que cuidan en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de San Pedro de Saño.
Desde hace 9 años se dedica al sacrificado oficio de albañil, brinda su servicio a varios clientes que lo solicitan. Su especialidad es la edificación de casas a base de ladrillo y cemento. Por la amplia trayectoria que tiene en la construcción logró ganarse el prestigio de una buena calidad de su trabajo. Él contrata la mano de obra de ayudantes que apoyan en la construcción y como líder está vigilando que toda la construcción se realice en orden. Este trabajo le ha permitido reunir rápidamente sus ingresos y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, por lo que seguirá  trabajando en este rubro. 
Por su parte, su esposa comenzó a dedicarse a la crianza de animales menores, como cuyes y gallinas, los que luego vende a los principales recreos turísticos y restaurantes de la zona.

Él pertenece al grupo “Cantuta” y éste es el crédito número 13 que tiene con MFP, donde agradece el apoyo que recibe, pues le permite progresar en su negocio. Además, promete ser puntual con el pago de sus cuotas, ya que sus compañeros son personas responsables y solidarias. 
Rosales invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de herramientas e insumos para sus construcciones, además de más cuyes y gallinas para el negocio de su esposa.
texts.en:
Rosales is 34 years old, and has been married to his wife Jessica for 8 years.  They live with their two children, Víctor and Jean Franco.  Their house is located in the community of San Pedro de Saño.  

For the past 9 years Rosales has made a living working as a builder.  He provides his services to different customers who request him.  His specialty is building brick and cement houses.  Because of Rosales’ extensive experience in construction, he has gained a reputation for the high quality of his work.  He hires workmen to help him with the construction work and supervises them to make sure the work is done properly.  Rosales’ work has allowed him to quickly increase his income and improve his living conditions, and so he plans to continue working in construction. 

Rosales’ wife, for her part, started raising small animals to help support the family.  She raises animals such as guinea pigs and chickens, which she then sells to the main tourist restaurants in the area.

Rosales belongs to the “Cantuta” group, and this is his 13th loan with MFP.  He is grateful for the support MFP has provided, since it has allowed him to move forward with his business.  He also promises to make all of his payments on time.  The other members of his group are all responsible and supportive people.    

Rosales plans to use the money he is requesting to purchase construction tools and supplies.  He will also use the money to buy more guinea pigs and chickens for his wife’s business.

loans.use: to purchase construction tools.

loans.name: Libardo

texts.es:
Desde que recibió su crédito Libardo se ha capitalizado, compró un congelador y le ha dada una mejor presentación a la fachada de su negocio, por eso reparte mas carne en mas tiendas.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo  credikiva, con el cual comprará mas carne  en un mayor volumen, con lo, cual planea bajar el costo de su producto y ser mas competitivo. Su meta es continuar incrementado su clientela y llegar a mas sitios, generar mas ingresos y lograr acceder a una nevera vitrina, pues prevee que con todo esta inversión y con su trabajó aumentará el bienestar de sus  hijos.Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente:
"Muchisimas gracias por todo el apoyo que me han brindado para salir adelante en mi negocio y espero que me sigan apoyando a prosperar y que Dios los bendiga. "
texts.en:
Libardo has reinvested since he received his loan.  He bought a freezer and has improved the appearance of the facade of his business.  For this reason he distributes more meat in more stores.

Currently he is applying for another Kiva loan, with which he will buy more wholesale meat.  He plans to lower the price of his product and be more competitive.

His goal is to continue expanding his clientele and reach more places, generate more income, and manage to get a display freezer.  He anticipates that his children's well-being will increase with all this investment and with his work.  His message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "Thank you very, very much for all the support you have given me to get ahead in my business.  I hope you continue helping me to prosper, and may God bless you."

loans.use: to buy more wholesale meat.

loans.name: El Suspiro Group

texts.es:
el suspiro es un grupo integrado por 9 mujeres muy alegres y trabajadoras cada una de ellas desarrolla una actividad economica para poder dar una mejor calidad de vida a su familia. ellas son:
Martha venta de refrescos
Amelia venta de antojitos 
Herminia venta de antojitos 
Maria del carmen venta de refrescos
Maria Isabel venta de abarrotes
Ofelia venta de refrescos
Reyna venta de perfumes
Eugenia venta de antojitos 
Dulce Maria Refaccionaria 

La señora Maria isabel tiene la edad de 36 años, solo estudio la secundaria y esta casada con el señor gregorio con el cual tiene dos hijos, ella platica que desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron a trabajar por siempre a buscado la manera de salir adelante y ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de su hogar y asi dar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.

Doña maria isabel desde hace un poco mas de 10 años abrió en su hogar una pequeña tienda de abarrotes la cual le a dado la oportunidad de trabajar y ganar su propio dinero, lo que mas le gusta de su negocio es el tratar con la gente a diario y el poder dar un servicio a su comunidad. ella abre su negocio todos los dias de ocho de la mañana hasta que se valla el ultimo cliente, en su tienda vende un poco de abarrotes, dulces y refresqueria.

ella invertira este credito en la compra de ceite de cocina, comida enlatada, frijoles, arroz, refrescos, dulces, sabritas, pan dulce, galletas, sal , azucar , mayonesa, jabon y cloro para resurtir su negocio.

ella espera que con esta inversion su negocio continue prosperando y sus ganancias aumenten para surtir mas su negocio y en un futuro sus hijas tengan mas estudios.

"gracias por el prestamo que nos dieron a todo mi grupo nos ayuda mucho en los negocios"
texts.en:
El suspiro ("the sigh") is a group made up of 9 happy and hard working women.  Each one of them in engaged in an economic activity that enables her to provide a better quality of life to her family.  They are:
Martha, who sells refreshments,
Amelia sells snacks,
Herminia sells snacks,
Maria del Carmen sells refreshments,
Marial Isabel sells groceries,
Ofelia sells snacks,
Reyna sell perfumes,
Eugenia sell snacks,
Dulce Maria has a repair shop.

Maria Isabel is 36 years old, has a high school education and is married to Mr. Gregorio with whom she has two children.  She says that from a young age her parents taught her to work hard so that she could get ahead and help her husband with the expenses of the home and this way provide a better life for her children.

Doña Maria Isabel opened a small grocery store in her home 10 years ago.  This has given her the opportunity to work and earn her own money.  What she most enjoys of her business is dealing with people on a daily basis and being able to provide a service to her community.  She opens her business every day from eight in the morning and until her last customer leaves.  In her store, she sells some groceries, refreshments and sweets.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of cooking oil, canned food, beans, rice, beverages,candies, snacks, cakes, crackers,salt, sugar, mayonnaise, soap and bleach to better supply her store.

She hopes that with this investment her business will continue to prosper and her income will grow and in the future her daughters will be able to get a better education.

"Thank you for the loan that was given to my whole group.  This helps us very much in our businesses."

loans.use: to purchase cooking oil, canned food, beans, rice, beverages,candies, snacks, cakes, crackers,salt, sugar, mayonnaise, soap and bleach.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To repair his existing combine harvester

loans.name: Anisa

texts.en:
Anisa is married and has eight children, ranging from eight to 21 years old. She describes herself as trustworthy and diligent. Anisa operates a garage where she sells spare parts and repairs cars and taxis. She has been involved in this business for 10 years and has five employees. Her garage is located within a viable business environment, and her primary customers are local residents.
Anisa is facing a challenge because of inadequate funds for improving the garage's retail business. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to purchase spare parts. Anisa previously took out a loan of Kes 50,000, which she has successfully repaid. Her goal is to run a big garage within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy spare car parts.

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a married woman.  She has six children who range in age from five to 18 years.  She describes herself to be an honest, trustworthy and courteous woman. 

She operates a retail store where she sells eggs.  She has been involved in this business for over 10 years.  Her business is located at a viable commercial area and her primary customers are retailers and local residents.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds for improving her business.  She will use the loan of 100,000 KES to buy eggs.  

Previously, Fatima took a loan of 50,000 KES, which she managed to repay in full.  Her business goal is to be the sole egg supplier in her hometown within five years. Fatima's dream and goal is to run additional retail stores that sell eggs.

loans.use: to buy more eggs to sell.

loans.name: Esha

texts.en:
Esha is a 60-year-old married woman.  She has five children who range in age from eight to 30 years.  She describes herself as an honest woman.  

Esha operates a retail stall where she sells fish.  She has been involved in this business for seven years.  Her business is located at a viable market place and her primary customers are the local residents and people who come to the market.  In addition, Esha runs a retail shop.  She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of transporting fish from where they are sourced.  She will use the loan of 80,000 KES to purchase more fish to sell.  Her business goal is to become a fish distributor within five years.  

In the future, Esha hopes to use the anticipated profits generated by this loan to build a house of her own.

loans.use: to purchase fish to stock and sell.

loans.name: Spiro

texts.en:
Spiro, a fifty-four-year-old man and a father of two young daughters, nine and six years old, lived in the countryside up to January of this year when they relocated to a little town in central Albania with a population of approximately 10,000 people. Upon arriving in the town, Spiro realized that there were no stores selling construction supplies and there were large construction projects going on building rental and condominiums, and main roads also.  Many people like himself from villages around were moving to the city and had started building houses. Therefore, the demand remains high for a hardware/construction store. 

It is Spiro's first time applying for a loan through VisionFund Albania. As of now, business has been going very well, yet Spiro wants to expand his construction items and stock up on electrical parts, power tools, paints, home cleaning products, etc. 

He considers himself responsible for paying back the loan and is also confident that his business will grow if he brings in the right items. Spiro’s dream is to buy a house in the town.

loans.use: To buy construction/hardware inventory

loans.name: Gjele

texts.en:
Gjele is a mother of six children, with the oldest one being forty-seven and the youngest twenty-three years old. Five of her children are married with one of them still being single and living at home. All of them live in North Albania where winters are extremely cold and snowy; springs are yellow/greeny colored and summers cool and dried.  Many foreign visitors visit that part of Albania during spring and summertime and also people from the capital city of Albania spend their weekends in the region's bed and breakfast houses.

This loan is Gjele’s second sequence with the institution with the previous one successfully being paid off.  Livestock and dairy has been the only business she has been involved in over the past thirteen years. She has been making organic salted and unsalted butter and cow's cheese. Gjele’s clientele is large and steady and they prepay for dairy products at the beginning of the month. Smiling she says, “Yes, I am happy with the work, the progress and the profit I earn.”
 
She is now planning on rebuilding her stable so that animals stay warm during the wintertime.

loans.use: To rebuild the stable where animals can stay warm during the cold winters

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is a 38-year-old married man. He has five children, ranging from six to 18 years old. He describes himself as an honest and aggressive man in his work. Anderson operates a retail store, where he sells household items such as sugar, salt, sodas, flour, cereals, and sweets. He has been involved in this business for three years. His store is located in a viable environment, and his primary customers are masons and local residents. 

Not only does Anderson sell household items, but he also sells trees for the construction of houses. He says his biggest business challenge is a shortage of household items to sell. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to purchase household items for resale. Previously, Anderson took out three loans, which he has repaid. His business goal is to register his retail business so as to grow his sales within the next five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have helped to improve the living standard of his customers.

loans.use: to buy household items to sell in his store.

loans.name: Riziki Group

texts.en:
Rukia, who is in her early forties, is married and has five children.  One of her children is an adult, three of them attend school and the last one is still young.  She has been selling bricks and eggs for three years now.  She works from 10:00 AM to 6:00 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to restock missing items and pay household expenses.   She has repaid both of her loans successfully.  She is requesting a new loan in order to buy more bricks and eggs to resell.  Her dream is to be able to build her own house.

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Riziki," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying their loans.

loans.use: to buy more bricks and eggs to resell.

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christoper is a 42-year-old married man. He describes himself to be an honest, strong, and visionary man. He operates a grocery store where he sells vegetables such as potatoes,cabbages, onions, and fruits. He has been involved in this business for 4 years. His business is located along a busy road and his primary customers are butcher men, hotels, and local residents. Not only does Christoper run a grocery store, he also works at a golf club.

Christopher describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of insufficient funds for improving the business. He will use the loan of 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) to purchase more vegetables and fruits. 

This is the first loan that Christoper is requesting from SMEP DTM. His business goal is to be a wholesaler of vegetables and fruits within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will be a supplier.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and fruits.

loans.name: Santos Placido

texts.es: Santos Placido de cuarenta y cuatro años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, el posee una tienda en su mismo lugar de residencia, donde vende productos de primera necesidad, pan, leche, huevos, jabón entre otros, se ha hecho de mucha clientela pues todo lo que comercia es de primera calidad y lo vende a precios realmente accesibles, el último mes bajaron sus ventas porque no pudo surtir la tienda al cien por ciento, debido a que tuvo gastos personales de sus hijos, quiere recuperarse y necesita de capital, es por eso que le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar granos básicos, productos instantáneos, pan, golosinas, jabón, etc. Santos es un hombre trabajador y muy responsable sabe que si surte el negocio obtendrá buenas ganancias y podrá saldar los pagos de la deuda, además sabe que de esta forma podrá llevar a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en: Santos Placido is forty-four years old and he lives with his life partner and their children. He runs a shop in the house where he lives, and he sells basic necessities such as bread, milk, eggs and soap. He has gained many customers because of the top quality of everything he sells and for his really affordable prices. During the last month his sales have decreased because he has not been able to fully stock up his shop, having had to pay for some extra expenses for his children. As he wants to recover and he needs working capital, he has decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan that will allow him to buy basic grains, instant foods, bread, sweets and soap. Santos is a greatly responsible and hard-working man, and he knows that if he stocks up his shop he will earn good money and will then be able to pay for his dues; he also knows that through this mean he will succeed in granting economic surety to his family.

loans.use: To buy basic grains, instant foods, bread, sweets and soap.

loans.name: Trust Group

texts.en:
Florida, who is in her early 30s, is single and has one child, who goes to school. She sells clothing for both adults and children, as well as fabric, door to door. She has been in this business for two years now. Florida works from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her clothing stock and to pay her household expenses. Florida has paid back all her loans successfully. She now wants a loan to start selling food and to increase her clothing stock to resell. Her dream is to one day be able to own a shop to sell her clothing and to stop going door to door looking for customers.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Trust," which has 17 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to start selling food and increase on the clothing stock to resell.

loans.name: Rashid

texts.en:
Rashid is a 38-year-old married man.  His wife is employed.  Together, they are blessed with two children, a son and a daughter, aged three and six years.  He describes himself to be welcoming. 

He operates a retail store where he sells home products such as salt, sugar, flour, maize flour, wheat flour, onions, tomatoes, mangoes etc.  He has been involved in this business for 10 years.  His business is located within a busy town and his primary customers are people who usually visit the town daily.

In addition, Rashid runs a construction business where he has eight employees.  He provides his construction services to companies and government offices.  He describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds for improving the business.  He will use the loan of 100,000 KES to purchase construction tools.  Rashid has previously taken a loan of 45,000 KES, which he managed to repay fully. 

He aspires to run a big retail shop within five years.  In addition, he hopes that in the future, he will run a big construction company.

loans.use: to buy construction tools.

loans.name: Daniel Isaias

texts.es: Daniel Isaías vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos, en una humilde vivienda, él se dedica a la producción de empiñadas que es una dulce rosca de harina con dulce y rellena de jalea de piña, muy deliciosa y solicitada por sus clientes; tiene mucho tiempo con el negocio, por lo que se ha hecho de mucha clientela, el las cocina en su casa y ya hay personas que llegan a comprarle por mayor para revenderlas de forma ambulante y embolsadas en los buses y principales calles del país. Sus clientes siempre lo buscan porque saben que su trabajo es de primera calidad. Daniel es un hombre trabajador enérgico, siempre está a la expectativa de nuevas oportunidades, piensa que la perseverancia es el ingrediente más importante del éxito, y él está dispuesto a buscarlo, ahora que quiere aumentar su producción necesita de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar harina, gas propano, jalea de piña y colorantes por mayor,  Daniel Isaías es muy responsable y tiene buenas referencias de pago, él sabe con su esfuerzo podrá pagar la deuda y le dará a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Daniel Isaías lives with his life partner and their children in a humble house. He engages in producing “empiñadas”, sweet flour ring-shaped pastries stuffed with pineapple jelly: they are really delicious and greatly requested by his customers. He has been engaged in this activity for a long time, having consequently gained many customers. He cooks the empiñadas in his house, and there are street vendors who come to his place to buy them at wholesale price: they them put them into plastic bags and resell them on the buses and along the main roads of the country. His customers always choose him because they know that his is a first class job. Daniel is an energetic and hardworking man, always looking for new chances: he thinks that perseverance is the most important ingredient of success, and he is willing to succeed. He now wants to increase his production and he needs some working capital: for this reason he has decided to ask INTEGRAL for a loan in order to buy flour, propane gas, pineapple jelly and food colorings at wholesale price. Daniel Isaías is very responsible and counts on good repayment references: he knows that thanks to his efforts he will be able to pay for his dues, as well as to grant a better standard of living to his family.

loans.use: To buy flour, propane gas, pineapple jelly and food colorings at wholesale price.

loans.name: Santa Rosa De Collana Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SANTA ROSA DE COLLANA”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fortunata; ella es casada y tiene 53 años y tiene 3 hijos; La socia trabaja con su negocio de tienda de abarrotes,la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y galletas,la socia trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,el sueño de la socia es ampliar y mejorar el negocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar arroz,azucar,leche,aceite y galletas al por mayor.
 Los otros socios  se dedican al negocio de venta de restaurant, negocio de crianza de animales, negocio de venta de comida, negocio de servicio de taxi, negocio de venta de cuyes y negocio de venta de ropa.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Santa Rosa de Collana Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

This member is Fortunata, 53.  She is married and has three children.  She works with her grocery store business selling convenience items such as rice, sugar, milk, oil, and cookies.  She works from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m.  She gets her children ahead with this business.  Her dream is to expand and improve her grocery store business.

She is requesting the loan to buy wholesale rice, sugar, milk, oil, and cookies.

The other members work in a restaurant business, animal sales, food sales, a taxi service, guinea pig sales, and clothing sales.

She is grateful to those who are part of this dream in this way and she promises to make her payments by the established deadline.

loans.use: to buy wholesale rice, sugar, milk, oil, and cookies.

loans.name: Japhesa

texts.en:
Japhesa is a married man. He has two children, ranging from eight to 18 years old. Japhesa describes himself as honest, trustworthy, and courteous. He operates a retail stall where he sells clothes. Japhesa has been involved in this business for 10 years and has two employees. His stall is in an accesible business area, and his primary customers are local residents.

Japhesa also provides transportation to customers using his motorcycle. He says his biggest business challenge is the stiff competition within the area. He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to purchase clothes for resale. His business goal is to run three more similar retail stores. He hopes that in the future he will be a wholesaler.

loans.use: to buy bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Marcila Magdalena

texts.es:
MARCILA MAGDALENA tiene 70 años de edad es divorsiada no tiene hijos, vive con los familiares en Chimbo provincia de Bolívar.

 MARCILA MAGDALENA tiene una tienda y vende de todo. Solicita el crédito para comprar 2 quintales de arroz, dos de azucar, aceite, sal.

Con la ayuda del crédito podrá comprar la mercadería que tanta falta le hace para incrementar la tienda y por ende los ingresos. 

 Las compras lo hara en Guaranda. El sueño es poder mejorar el nivel de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta caminar.
texts.en:
Marcila Magdalena is 70 years old, and is divorced without any children. She lives with her family members in Chimbo, in the province of Bolivar. Marcila Magdalena owns and operates a general store that sells a little bit of everything.

With the support from this loan, she plans to purchase additional merchandise to further stock her business and increase her income. She buys products in Guaranda for resale in her store, and her dream is to improve her quality of life. In her free time, she likes to walk.

loans.use: to purchase rice, sugar, oil and salt.

loans.name: Fatmir

texts.en:
Fatmir is in his mid-thirties and a father of two: a three-year-old girl and a nine-month-old boy. He has been carrying out his transportation business since 2002 and has plenty of experience. Some years back, with another loan from VisionFund Albania, he bought a van for transporting school children from their village to the nearby village where the school has been located since. Not many people in this village can afford to have a car, so their children walk about 90 min. to and from school every day. The village is located in Northern Albania where winters are extremely cold and snowy. “I am a father myself and it breaks my heart to see children walking for so long in cold weather conditions,” Fatmir says. 

“Children are my little fellow clients. No one else offers my services in our village,” he said, “yet I don’t own a van anymore, because the one I had was destroyed after all these years of using it.” Fatmir is applying for a loan now to buy another used van, and this would be his second sequence with the institution with the previous one repaid in full. “Hopefully, my dreams and those of the families who have school children will be fulfilled,” he adds.

Fatmir appreciates lenders’ understanding in this matter.

loans.use: To buy a safe mini-van for driving children to and from school

loans.name: Sansasyon De Ferrier 1, 2, 3, 4, 5 Group

texts.fr:
Jaqueline est la coordonatrice de son groupe Sansasyon de Ferrier. Elle habite dans la région de CAP-H d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a 4 enfants

Jacqueline a dirigé son commerce de produit alimentaire. Elle voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans plusieurs produit.  Des autres membres des Sansasyon de Ferrier ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires, charbon et des produits cosmétiques.

Jacqueline dit que son défit principal est manque d’acheteurs constants a cause du chômage. Elle dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce pour qu’elle devenir un grand commerçant.
texts.en:
Jaqueline is the organizer in her group, Sansasyon de Ferrier. She resides in the CAP-H region of Haiti, where electricity is rare and water access quite limited. She has four children.

Jacqueline manages her own grocery store. She would like to use this loan to invest in several products. Other members of Sansasyon de Ferrier need their loans for such businesses as the retail of food products, coal, and cosmetics.

Jacqueline says that her main challenge is the lack of regular customers due to unemployment. She says that her dream is to grow her business to become a major retailer.

loans.use: to purchase food products.

loans.name: Wilson Ramiro

texts.es:
Wilson se destaca por ser una persona feliz, responsable con y su familia y sobre todo muy trabajador. Wilson vive con sus tres hijos cerca de la ciudad de Ibarra en la provincia de Imbabura.

Wilson trabaja con unos socios en la simbra de tomate y fréjol, al momento se encuentra terminando la cocecha del anterior sembrío y necesita continuar con su labor en la agricultura, es por eso que realiza un nuevo préstamo en Fodemi, el mismo que va a ser invertido en la compra de fungicidas, abonos, semillas de tomate y fréjol para que su producción sea de mejor calidad y pueda obtener buenos ingresos y poder ayudar a su familia en los gastos de estudios.

Wilson sueña con mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos, que tengan buena salud y por el seguir en la agricultura y producir siempre.
texts.en:
Wilson is known to be a happy, hard-working man who is very dedicated to his family. He lives with his three children near the city of Ibarra in the province of Imbabura.

Wilson works alongside other farmers in the cultivation of tomatoes and beans. He has just finished with the harvest season, and needs to continue working to clean and maintain his crops. He is requesting a new loan with Fodemi, which he plans to invest in the purchase of fungicides, manure, and tomato and bean seeds. He hopes this investment will yield a higher quality harvest of his produce so that he can generate more income and in turn help his family with household and education expenses.

Wilson's dream is to improve his children's quality of life and give them the opportunity to lead healthy lives. He works very hard to provide for them.

loans.use: to purchase fungicides, manure, and tomato and bean seeds for planting.

loans.name: Protea Group

texts.en:
Patricia, who is in her late twenties, is married and has one small child.  She has had a pharmacy for four years now.  She works from 8:00 AM to 9:30 PM daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She plans to use it to buy more medicine to resell.  Her dream is to be able to open another pharmacy in a different area in the future.  

She will share this loan with her loan group, "Protea," which has a total of 15 members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy more medicine to resell.

loans.name: Luz Y Vida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Luz y Vida está formado por 8 socias y 1 socio quienes se dedican  día a día a sus labores las mismas que le permiten solventar los gastos de sus hogares y sacar adelante a sus familias y mejorar su estabilidad económica, son personas amables, gentiles y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad tiene varios lugares para visitar y disfrutar de la naturaleza, gracias a su belleza arquitectónica es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Gloria Susana, tiene 44 años de edad, es madre soltera de 5 hijos de 29, 27, 24, 21 y 19 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, dos hijas son casadas y viven independientes, su último hijo está estudiando en una escuelita de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
 
La Señora. Gloria Susana hace un año se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y varios artículos para el hogar, también cría gallinas y cuyes los que vende en su comunidad, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.
 
Se encuentra en el segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de zapatos, ropa y artículos para el hogar para tener una mayor variedad de productos para su clientela.
 
Su sueño es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Luz y Vida (Light and Life) is a Communal Bank composed of 8 women and 1 man. All the members daily engage in their activities, which allow them to pay for their households’ expense, to provide for their families and to improve their economic conditions. They are nice and gentle people who still maintain and follow their culture and traditions. They live in the outskirts of Cuenca, a town with many places to visit and where it is possible to enjoy natural beauties. Thanks to its architectural beauty, Cuenca is a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1999.

Gloria Susana is one of the members od this group. She is 44 years old and she is a single mother of 5 children, aged 29, 27, 24, 21 and 19. He first two children have a job and they economically help her, two daughters are married and live independently and her youngest son is attending one of the schools in town. She lives in a rented house as she doesn’t have one of her own.

Gloria Susana has been engaged in selling clothes, shoes and various home products for one years; at the same time, she also breeds hens and “cuyes” (“cuy” is Quechua for Guinea pig), and she sells these animals in her community. She does not work fixed hours, but she works from Sunday to Sunday.

This is her second loan with her Communal Bank; the loan she is requesting will be used to buy shoes, clothes and home products to have a wider variety of products for her customers.

She dreams of having a house of her own.

loans.use: To buy shoes, clothes and home products

loans.name: Edlin Lucero

texts.es: La Señorita Edlin  tiene 22 años y es soltera,  Ella vende diferentes tipos de ropa a crédito ofrece sus productos en su barrio, visita oficinas públicas privadas, donde le va muy bien ya que tiene muchos clientes que también le hacen pedidos, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya 2 años, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  Edlin utilizara este préstamo para la compra  de chompas de algodón por su negocio ya que tiene un pedido que entregar, Su razón para solicitar este préstamo es aumentar inventario. Edlin  enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la gran cantidad de competencia en el mercado ya que así como ella hay varias personas que ofrecen sus productos en oficinas Ella va a utilizar los beneficios tener una tienda propia y sueña con el tiempo tener una red de tiendas en Bolivia, ella es una persona joven emprendedora con ganas de superación y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Edlin is 22 years old and is single. She sells different types of clothing on credit, selling her products in her neighborhood. She visits public and private offices, where it is going very well as she has many clients who make orders and she has been doing this activity for 2 years. 

This is her first loan cycle with this institution. Edlin will use the money from the loan to buy cotton pullovers for her business as she already has an order to fulfill. Her reason for asking for this loan is to increase her inventory. Edlin faces challenges in her business such as a large amount of competition in the market as there are several people that sell their products in offices.

She will use the profits to have her own store and dreams of eventually having a network of stores in Bolivia. She is an enterprising young person with hopes of succeeding and she is grateful for the opportunity given to her.

loans.use: to buy cotton pullovers

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es: Gradys cuando accedió a su primer credikiva, compró  marcos para elaborar cuadros y materiales con los que hizo muchos productos; así mismo pagó a sus proveedores y quedó listo para volver a invertir. Por eso en la actualidad está planeando un nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará meterías primas y elaborará artesanías en madera a las que aplicará sus mejores pinturas. Ella dice a sus  financiadores que muchas gracias por ayudarla con el crédito porque pudo capitalizar su negocio y comprar sus materias prima de contado  y espera seguir contando con esta ayuda. “
texts.en:
When she got her first Kiva loan, Gladys bought frames to make paintings and materials with which she made many other products.  She also paid her suppliers and was ready to invest again.  For this reason, currently she is planning another Kiva loan, with which she will buy raw materials to make wood handicrafts on which she will apply her best paintings.

She says to her lenders that she thanks them very much for helping her with the loan because she was able to reinvest in her business and pay cash for her materials.  She hopes to continue having this support.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make wood handicrafts for her paintings.

loans.name: Diana Jazmina

texts.es:
Diana es una mujer de 28 años madre de tres hijos; juntos viven en "Santo Domingo" que es la cuarta ciudad con más población del Ecuador después de Guayaquil, Quito y Cuenca (las ciudades más importantes del país). Su población va creciendo rápidamente ya que cuenta con un rico comercio y el mayor mercado ganadero del país. Su temperatura habitual es de unos 25.5°C  y a veces llega a los 38 °C. Toda la provincia de "Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas"  figura como parte del territorio montañoso de la costa, de la cordillera occidental, históricamente conocida como Provincia de Yumbos y Capital de los Colibríes. Está ubicado en el trópico húmedo de América Latina. Es una provincia considerada nueva ya que fue creada en el 2007.

Esta emprendedora desde hace 5 años inició su negocio de venta de calzado puerta a puerta; diariamente ella trabaja 6 horas al día recorriendo las calles de la ciudad donde reside. Esta actividad es muy dura de realizar ya que debe caminar mucho y con una mochila donde tienen su mercadería que tiene un peso considerable. Diana desea invertir en mercadería, ya que la venta de calzado requiere de stock debido a la variedad de tallas y colores; por esta razón ella recurrió a un crédito con el cual pueda invertir en mercadería. Con esto ella aspira tener mayores ingresos al tener mayores ventas. Ella sueña con tener su propio local de zapatos ya que le gusta esta actividad y en un futuro poder dar a sus hijos una casa donde puedan vivir más cómodamente.
texts.en:
Diana is a 28 year old woman and the mother of three children. They live together in Santo Domingo which is the fourth most populous city in Ecuador after Guayaquil, Quito, and Cuenca (the most important cities of the country.) The population is growing rapidly because it has a rich trade and the largest cattle market in the country. Its normal temperature is 25.5 Celsius (80 Fahrenheit) and sometimes reaches 38 Celsius (100 Fahrenheit). All the province of Santo Domingo de los Tsáchilas forms part of the mountainous territory of the coast, of the western mountain range, historically known as Province of Yumbos and Capital de los Colibríes. It is located in the humid tropics of Latin America. It is considered a new province since it was created in 2007.

This entrepreneur began her business 5 years ago selling shoes door to door.  She works 6 hours daily traversing the streets of the city where she lives. It is hard work because she walks a lot with a backpack carrying her merchandise that is heavy. Diana wants to invest in merchandise since the sale of shoes requires an inventory of a variety of sizes and colors. For this reason she is resorting to a loan in order to invest in merchandise. With this she is hoping to have higher earnings and more sales. She dreams of having her own shoe store as she likes this work, and in the future to be able to give her children a home where they can live more comfortably.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell

loans.name: Amriddin

texts.ru: Амриддин трудолюбивый и добрый семьянин. Он честный и воспитанный человек. Более 3-х лет он занимается купле- продажей крупного и мелкого рогатого скота. Еженедельно покупает скот и привозит их домой откармливает в течении недели, затем заново продает за выгодную цену. Амриддин запрашивает займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса и получения хорошей прибыли. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Amriddin is a hardworking and kind family man.  He is an honest and well mannered person.   For more then 3 years he has been purchasing and selling large and small livestock.  He purchases livestock weekly and brings it home to fatten over a week and then resells it for a profit.  Amriddin is asking for a loan to purchase livestock in order to grow his business and earn a good profit.  He is hopping for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy livestock in order to expand his business

loans.name: Demain Ensemble Group

texts.fr: Demain Ensemble est une institution scolaire qui fait de l'enseignement inclusif. L'enseignement inclusif a pour vocation d'enseigner des enfants handicapés en même temps que des enfants valides dans les mêmes salles de classe. Cela permet d'éviter l'exclusion et la stigmatisation dont sont souvent victimes les handicapés. Demain Ensemble est dirigé par un professeur en retraite qui a été lui même victime d'un handicap visuel avant la fin de sa carrière  professionnelle.Il s'est fixé comme défit de donner aux enfants handicapés la possibilité d'accéder comme tous les enfants à une éducation de qualité. Créée il y'a trois ans, l'institution compte un cycle préscolaire et primaire et accueille à la fois des enfants qui souffrent de handicap visuel, auditif, moteur et intellectuel. Afin de renforcer l'équipement et d'installer l'électricité , Demain ensemble sollicite un pret de 750000f auprès de UIMCEC.L'ambition du groupe est de construire ses propres locaux pour avoir de meilleurs conditions d'études.
texts.en:
"Demain Ensemble" is an educational institution providing inclusive education.  Inclusive education is committed to teaching children with disabilities, along with children free of disabilities, within the same classroom.  Inclusive education ensures that children with disabilities are no longer excluded or stigmatized, as this is something that happens frequently. 

"Demain Ensemble" is led by a retired teacher who himself became visually impaired before the end of his professional career.  Since then, he has dedicated himself to giving special-need students the same opportunities as non-disabled children, making it possible for them to access quality education.  

Founded three years ago, the institution is open to preschool and elementary students and welcomes children who may be suffering from visual or hearing impairments, or physical or intellectual disabilities.  

In order to upgrade the school's equipment and to install electricity, "Demain Ensemble" is requesting a loan of 750,000 francs from the UIMCEC.  The group's ambition is to build its own facilities in order to offer a better learning environment.

loans.use: to upgrade his school's equipment and install electricity.

loans.name: Bahriniso

texts.ru: Бахринисо вдова и на воспитании имеет двоих детей. Более 5 лет она занимается купле- продажей продуктов питания, одежду и ткани. В месяц один раз ездит за товаром и приобретает необходимые товары для нужды населения. Бахринисо хотела бы получить займ для покупки нового ассортимента товара. Она надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Bahriniso is a widow and is raising two children.  For more than 5 years she has been purchasing and selling food, clothing and fabrics.  Once a month she travels for her products and purchases necessary products for the needs of the population.  Bahriniso would like to take out a loan to purchase new products.  She hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy new products for sale

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.ru: Бобомурод занимается купле- продажей скота  последние 4 года. Он женат и его жена занимается домохозяйством. Еженедельно покупает скот и привозит их домой, затем откармливает их в течении недели и продает за хорошую цену. Бобомурод хотел бы получить займ для покупки скота с целью расширения бизнеса. Он надеется на вашу помощь и доброту.
texts.en: Bobomurod has been purchasing and selling livestock for the past 4 years.  He is married and his wife takes care of their home.  Each week he purchases livestock and brings it home, then he fattens it over a week and sells it for a good price.  Bobomurod  would like to get a loan to purchase livestock in order to expand his business.  He hopes for your help and kindness.

loans.use: to buy cattle in order to expand his business

loans.name: Jezi Konen Group

texts.fr:
Marieclaude est la coordonatrice de son groupe Jezi Konen. Elle habite dans la région de CAP-H d’Haïti où de l’électricité est rare et de l’eau est très limitée. Elle a dirigé son commerce de vente divers ellel est aussi pendent les 8 dernières années.

Marieclaude voudrait utiliser cet emprunt pour investir dans achete produits divers, que des vêtements, des cosmétiques, des chaussures.

Des autres membres des Jezi Konen ont besoin d’un emprunt pour tels commerces comme vendre des produits alimentaires et des produits cosmétiques. Marieclause dit que son rêve est d’agrandir son commerce pour qu’il devenir un grand commerçant.
texts.en:
Marieclaude is the coordinator of the Jezi Konen group.  She lives in the CAP-H region of Haiti where electricity is scarce and the water supply very limited.  For the past eight years, she has been managing her own retail business and selling various goods. 

Marieclaude would like to use this loan to invest in the purchase of such various items as clothes, cosmetics and shoes.

Other members of the Jezi Konen group need a loan to finance activities such as retail food businesses or cosmetic sales businesses.  Marieclaude says that her dream is to expand her business and to become a major retailer.

loans.use: to buy various items such as clothes, cosmetics and shoes.

loans.name: Gbenondjiou Group

texts.fr: Le groupe GBENONDJIOU est composé de trois personnes qui sont des amies et qui appartiennent à un même groupe de tontine. C'est la troisième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Viviane Eyitayo Kikè est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Viviane Eyitayo Kikè est âgée de 38 ans et vit au Bénin. Viviane Eyitayo Kikè a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. Viviane Eyitayo Kikè est mariée à un mécanicien du nom de André. Le couple a trois enfants à leur charge, tous scolarisés. Viviane Eyitayo Kikè vit ensemble avec son mari et ses enfants. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Afin de faire face aux diverses charges de sa famille, Viviane Eyitayo Kikè vend depuis six ans, de la nourriture (la sauce de tomate accompagnée de la pâte de maïs et du riz). Viviane Eyitayo Kikè vend aussi de façon secondaire des fournitures scolaires de manière ambulante. Viviane Eyitayo Kikè s’approvisionne dans un marché du Benin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaires et son revenu, Viviane Eyitayo Kikè sollicite ensemble avec les autres membres du groupe GBENONDJIOU, un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.
texts.en:
The  GBENONDJIOU group consists of three women who are friends and belong to the same savings group.  It is the third time that this group is requesting financial assistance from ALIDé in order to increase its level of activity.

The group's representative, Viviane Eyitao Kikè is the woman raising her hand in the photo.  She is 38 years old, lives in Benin, and she left school at the elementary level.  She is married to André, a mechanic.  André and Viviane Eyitayo Kikè have three children in their care, all of whom attend school.  Viviane Eyitayo Kikè lives with her husband and children.  The couple jointly takes care of the various household expenses. 

In order to cover the various expenses of her family, Viviane Eyitayo Kikè has been selling food products (tomato sauce with maize paste and rice) for the past six years.  Additionally, she also sells school supplies as an itinerant seller.  She buys her goods at a market in Benin.

Eager to meet her customers' needs, and in order to increase her turnover and income, Viviane Eyitayo Kikè is requesting a third loan from ALIDé, along with the other members of the GBENONDJIOU group.  Previous loans have been well repaid.

loans.use: to buy maize, rice and condiments.

loans.name: Giovana

texts.es: La señora Giovana tiene 25 años, ella es soltera tiene dos hijos que son de las edades de 9 y 2 años, ella ahora tiene su tienda de barrio donde ofrece variedad de productos de primera necesidad, antes se dedicaba  a la venta de comida pero esto era un trabajo arduo y con sus dos hijos pequeños no se daba tiempo para elaborar su comida,  la señora debe de trabajar muy duro ya que es madre soltera y ella debe de cubrir todos los gastos para mantener a sus hijos en su tienda le va muy bien genera más ingresos y esto le permite mejorar su calidad de vida, la Sra. Giovana, con el dinero del crédito comprara abarrotes por mayor como fideo, arroz, harina y variedad de refrescos para surtir su tienda, es una persona  muy dinámica agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Giovana is twenty-five years old and single with two children, aged nine and two. Currently, she has a neighborhood store where she offers a variety of products of primary necessity. Before, she made a living through food sales, but this was difficult work and her two small children left her with little time for food preparation. She must work very hard, since she is a single mother, and she must cover all the expenses for maintaining her two children. 

Her grocery business is going very well and generates more income. This allows her to improver her quality of life. With the money from the loan, Giovana will purchase groceries wholesale—including noodles, rice, flour, and a variety of soft drinks—in order to stock her store. She is a very dynamic person and she is grateful to the institution for the support that it provides.

loans.use: to buy groceries such as sugar, rice, noodles, and a variety of sodas

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a driven and eager individual who loves nothing more than being his own boss, while also providing a needed service to the community around him. A few years ago, he saw the need for more handicap accessible ramps in businesses and homes around him. Due to the aging of the baby-boomer generation, he sees his field as essential and one that will only become more necessary in the coming years. The ramps that his company builds are all customized to the building and built on location. This way every ramp fits in structurally and environmentally. To build these ramps in his area of Minnesota because of how spread out his contracts are, it is essential for him to have a truck to transport the parts to each site. However, recently he has been having problems with his truck. This loan would help him repair his truck so he can continue to provide for his customers within a vast area. Robert aspires to continue to build this business in the future with the hopes of employing more people and the ongoing goal of making his community handicap accessible for people with various disabilities.

loans.use: to repair the company vehicle

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
JOSE MIGUEL tiene 65 años de edad es casado tiene 4 hijos, Vive en San José de Chimbo Provincia de Bolívar con la esposa y con el hijo menor porque los demás son casados.

JOSE MIGUEL se dedica a realizar fletes el es chofer. Solicita el crédito para pago de deuda. con la ayuda del crédito podrá pagar la deuda que lo realizó por enfermedad. La cancelación de la deuda se la realizará en Guaranda. 

Los desafíos a los que se enfrenta son las enfermedades. El sueño es poder contar con salud para poder ayudar a la familia.
En el tiempo lire le gusta jugar boli.
texts.en:
José Miguel is sixty-five years old and married with four children. He lives in San José de Chimbo in the Bolívar province of Ecuador with his wife and youngest son, since his other children are married.

José Miguel makes his living through transportation, as he is a chauffeur. He is requesting this loan in order to pay his debt. With the help of the loan he will be able to pay the debt that he accrued due to illness. The cancellation of the debt will take place in Guaranda (another province of Ecuador).
